line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Srivatsa is a commonly\nused surname in Hindu names.&nbsp; Lord\nParasurama an avatar of Vishnu was born in this Gotra.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">The endless knot of Sri\nVatsa is found on Vishnu\u2019s right side chest.&nbsp;\nThis symbol represents the interweaving of change with time.&nbsp;&nbsp; Srivatsa is one of the 1008 names of\nLord&nbsp; Vishnu in the Vishnu Sahasranam.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">The Kaustubh Mani was a\npowerful deep blue diamond with a radiance equal to the sun.&nbsp; It was obtained during the churning of the\nsea ( Samudra Manthan ) .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Lord Vishnu wears\nKaustubh Mani&nbsp; in a garland on his\nchest.&nbsp;&nbsp; This tone&nbsp; brings invincibility on to its wearer .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">The Srivatsa mark on\nLord Vishnu\u2019s right chest is due to this diamond, which caused a design of fine\nyellow hair in an endless knot geometrical form\u2014as per Sree Bhagawatham&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (SB 10.13.48)<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">SAHAR VAKSH STHAL\nKAUSTUBHASHRIYAM, NAMAMI VISHNUM SIRASA CHATURBHUJAM ||<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">This hymn talks about\nthe Kaustubha diamond on Vishnu. .&nbsp; Both\nSrivatsa and Kaustubha are generally listed together in the&nbsp;&nbsp; same line, often in the same word even, in\nthe verses of the Bhagavatam.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Bhaktivedanta\nVedaBase:&nbsp; \u015ar\u012bmad Bh\u0101gavatam&nbsp; 5.3.3<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">atha\nha tam \u0101vi\u1e63k\u1e5bta-bhuja-yugala-dvaya\u1e3f hira\u1e47maya\u1e3f puru\u1e63a-vi\u015be\u1e63a\u1e3f\nkapi\u015ba-kau\u015bey\u0101mbara-dharam urasi vilasac-chr\u012bvatsa-lal\u0101ma\u1e3f\ndaravara-vanaruha-vana-m\u0101l\u0101cch\u016bry-am\u1e5bta-ma\u1e47i-gad\u0101dibhir upalak\u1e63ita\u1e3f sphu\u1e6da-kira\u1e47a-pravara-muku\u1e6da-ku\u1e47\u1e0dala-ka\u1e6daka-ka\u1e6di-s\u016btra-h\u0101ra-key\u016bra-n\u016bpur\u0101dy-a\u0144ga-bh\u016b\u1e63a\u1e47a-vibh\u016b\u1e63itam\n\u1e5btvik-sadasya-g\u1e5bha-patayo 'dhan\u0101 ivottama-dhanam upalabhya sabahu-m\u0101nam arha\u1e47en\u0101vanata-\u015b\u012br\u1e63\u0101\u1e47a\nupatasthu\u1e25</span><o:p></o:p></span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">\u201c Lord Vi\u1e63h\u1e47u appeared\nbefore King N\u0101bhi with four arms. He was very bright, and He appeared to be the\nbest of all personalities. Around the lower portion of His body, He wore a\nyellow silken garment. On His chest was the mark of \u015ar\u012bvatsa, which always\ndisplays beauty. He carried a conchshell, lotus flower, disc and club, and He\nwore a garland of forest flowers and the Kaustubha gem. He was beautifully\ndecorated with a helmet, earrings, bangles, belt, pearl necklace, armlets,\nankle bells and other bodily ornaments bedecked with radiant jewels. Seeing the\nLord present before them, King N\u0101bhi and his priests and associates felt just\nlike poor people who have suddenly attained great riches. They received the\nLord and respectfully bent their heads and offered Him things in worship\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WbUt1WveNvA/VCjNc51BIYI/AAAAAAAAweY/4k89Dc1XwrM/s1600/Untitleyyd-3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"388\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WbUt1WveNvA/VCjNc51BIYI/AAAAAAAAweY/4k89Dc1XwrM/s1600/Untitleyyd-3.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Your personal brand is\nwhat WE THE PEOPLE &nbsp;say about you, behind\nyour back . font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE: All the great\nsaints and sages could not decide that out of the Trinity Lord Vishnu, Brahma\nand Shiv who is pre-eminent and to whom should they offer Pradhanta (Master) of\nthat yagya. &nbsp;With the consent of all the\ngreat saints present there, it was decided that Maharishi Bhrigu will test and\ndecide who was pre-eminent.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upon being entrusted\nwith the task Maharishi Bhrigu decided to test Lord Brahma first. He went on to\nsee Lord Brahma in Brahmaloka. On reaching Brahmalok Maharishi displayed utter\ndisrespect to Lord Brahma on purpose ( he became ghull \u2013<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> hid under the bed&nbsp; TEE HEEE</span> ) . &nbsp;Lord Brahma got angry and wanted to punish\nMaharishi but Maha Saraswati, wife of Lord Brahma saved Maharishi from his\nanger. &nbsp;Angry with disrespect, Maharishi\nBhrigu cursed Lord Brahma that no one will worship Brahma in Kaliyuga. &nbsp;To this day, there are very few temples\ndevoted to Lord Brahma (the notable exception being the Brahma Temple at\nPushkar).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharishi Bhrigu then\ndecided to visit Lord Shiva at Kailash Parvata. &nbsp;On reaching Kailash Parvat, Nandi stopped him\nfrom going inside because at that time, Shiva and Parvathi were sporting fun (\nbusy having sexual intercourse and <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">could NOT stop the humping TEE HEEE </span>) .\nBhrigu curses Lord Shiva to be only worshipped in Linga (<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> erect penis dripping\nsemen </span>) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;form. (We however have a\nstatue form of lord Shiva in Kashi (Maha Mrityunjaya Temple) said to be over\n400 years old.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then in order to test\nLord Vishnu, Maharishi reached Vaikunth Dhama. &nbsp;He entered the Dhama without Lord Vishnu's\npermission and saw that the Lord was resting at that time. Maharishi asked him\nto wake up, but Lord was in deep sleep. (<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> How can you wake up somenody\npretending to sleep without a resounding kick TEE HEEEE </span>) On seeing no reaction\nfrom Lord, Maharishi kicked Lord Vishnu on his chest (that strike by Maharishi\nBhrigu left a foot print on Lord's chest and that foot print is known as\n\"Shri Vatsa\").<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Below: Our sapta rishis are seven stars of great bear (Ursa Major) constellation-- which revolve like the SWASTIKA around Dhruv. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nTamas / Sattwa / Rajas ( Brahma / Vishnu/ Shiva ) represents\nthe organization of primal energy , the foundation of universal laws ,\nrelativity , stability of nature. &nbsp;&nbsp;The law holds together the endless spiral of\ngalaxies . <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nIt is a perfect tango of dynamic balance where one polar\nopposite changes into another smoothly and constantly . &nbsp;If the restraining balance or equilibrium is\nlost , the universe will spiral out of control and end. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nTamas Rajas , which are rooted together , is present in\nevery phenomenon on earth., where energy transforms from one to another\u2014it can\nneither be created or destroyed.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nThese two opposing forces are natural and transform each\nother , in perfect harmony.&nbsp; Harmony can\nnever be stagnant .&nbsp; Lessening of Tamas\nalways results in increase of Rajas and vice versa<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nOne cannot exist without the other and they are dependant\n.&nbsp; No phenomenon in this universe is\ncompletely devoid of its opposite.&nbsp; They\nconsume each other yet support each other.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nWhatever is in excess gets reduces, whatever is deficient\ngets replenished.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nBalance can never be permanent\u2014 Tamas and Rajas continiously\ndevour each other \u2013 and life flows on.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nAbsolute magic!<o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-srsjKTONgrM/VCbMh73vK0I/AAAAAAAAwXM/KWkb2OxEVVg/s1600/59832gvc25.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"494\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-srsjKTONgrM/VCbMh73vK0I/AAAAAAAAwXM/KWkb2OxEVVg/s1600/59832gvc25.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Navratri is all about\nGoddess SHAKTI destroying cosmic forces of disharmony .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Goddess Shakti ( in Durga form ) is Ashtak\nor eight armed .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How many of you know\nthat AZTEC of Mexico is derived from Goddess Shakti?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Have you ever seen the &nbsp;Ashtabhuja,, the eight armed Goddess ( below ) &nbsp;- &nbsp; &nbsp;found\nin Mexican temples ?&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; This is a Hindu concept .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">gne\ntanuva\u2019\u1e43 pipraya\u2019sv\u0101smabhya\u2019\u1e43 ca saubha\u2019gam\u0101ya\u2019jasva ||<o:p></o:p></span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">gobhirju\u1e63\u1e6da\u2019mayujo ni\u1e63i\u2019kta\u1e43\ntave\u201dndra vi\u1e63\u1e47oranusa\u00f1ca\u2019rema |<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">n\u0101ka\u2019sya p\u1e5b\u1e63\u1e6dhamabhi sa\u1e43vas\u0101\u2019no\nvai\u1e63\u1e47a\u2019v\u012b\u1e43 loka iha m\u0101\u2019dayant\u0101m ||<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">o\u1e43 k\u0101ty\u0101yan\u0101ya\u2019\nvidmahe\u2019 kanyakum\u0101ri\u2019 dh\u012bmahi | tanno\u2019 durgi\u1e25 pracoday\u0101\u201dt ||<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">o\u1e43 \u015b\u0101nti\u1e25 \u015b\u0101nti\u1e25 \u015b\u0101nti\u2019\u1e25\n||</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse I:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We shall press out the\nSoma Juice to Jatavedas (Deva Agni). &nbsp;May\nthe all-knowing annihilate our enemies. &nbsp;May Agni protect us against all obstacles and\nevils and take us across them like a boatman who takes people across the river\nin a boat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse II:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I take refuge in that\nGoddess Durga who is of the color of Fire, who blazes with her tapas (spiritual\nfire), who is the consort of Virochana (the Supreme Being) and who is the\nbestower of the fruit of actions. Obeisance to Thee who art skilled in ferrying\npeople across the river of the World. Be pleased to ferry us across.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse III:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">O Agni, who art worth\nof Praise, take us across all obstacles by ways that are safe. May our town and\nour lands expand. Make our children happy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse IV:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thou Jatavedas, who art\nthe remover of obstacles, take us beyond all evil like the boatman who ferries\nthe people across the river. O Agni, may you be a careful protector of our\nbodies like Atri who is always concerned with the welfare of all beings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse V:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let us invoke, from the\nhighest places, Agni the vanquisher of enemy hosts, who is powerful and\ninvincible. May that Agni protect us against all obstacles and evils.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse VI:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">O Agni, praised in\nsacrifices, thou increasest bliss. Thou art the ancient and the new invoker at\nsacrifices. O Agni, make Thyself happy and grant us prosperity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse VII:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">O Indra, all-pervading!\nWe shall follow thee blessed with cattle and unbroken happiness. May those who\nlive on the heights of heaven bring here the world of Vishnu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse VIII:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">We shall try to know\nKatyayani, we shall engage in contemplation on Kanyakumari may Durga be pleased\nto guide us.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">OM! Shanti: Shanti:\nShanti:</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tKoQSjrHo3k/VCbQw_Z4fDI/AAAAAAAAwXg/3vbKzSLJ538/s1600/imaghvfes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tKoQSjrHo3k/VCbQw_Z4fDI/AAAAAAAAwXg/3vbKzSLJ538/s1600/imaghvfes.jpg\" width=\"281\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Goddess Shakti ( Durga &nbsp;)is the mother of the universe and is the KINETIC\npower behind the work of creation, preservation, and destruction of the world. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since time immemorial she has been\nworshipped as the supreme power of the Supreme Being and has been mentioned in our\nVedas of 5000 BC .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Goddess Durga form\nof Shakti is depicted as having eight hands. &nbsp;These represent eight Vaastu quadrants &nbsp;in Hinduism .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Goddess Durga is\ndepicted as a fierce warrior woman with eight hands carrying weapons of\ndifferent kinds assuming mudras, (symbolic hand gestures) that represent her .\nShakti is a force and Durga is thus personalized form of a cosmic allegory.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Chakra in her 1st\nupper right hand \u2013&nbsp; is a scalar energy interferometry\nvortex, &nbsp;used by Lord Krishna in\nMahabharata to create a severe temperature inversion and cause the sun to go\nbelow the horizon form Arjun to kill Jatadrata..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Conch in her first upper\nleft hand \u2014represents OM 7.83 hertz , &nbsp;the\nfrequency of this planet , and the Golden mean of 1.618 ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Sword in her second\nright lower hand \u2013 to decapitate evil ( forces causing cosmic disharmony ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Bow and arrow in her\nsecond left lower hand \u2013 Scalar thunderbolt<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Lotus Flower in her\nthird lower left hand \u2013 &nbsp;Power granted to\nher by Brahma .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Club in her third\nright lower hand \u2013Power granted to her by Vishnu \u2013 the mace gadha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Trident/Trishul in\nher fourth left lower hand \u2013 &nbsp;power granted\nto her Shiva (Tamas/ Sattwa / Rajas ).</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Fourth Lower Right\nHand symbolizes \u2013 Scalar field Healing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-sfegP4bo0bo/VCbROA91ihI/AAAAAAAAwXw/Z5Y2UQMora0/s1600/imjvdages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"265\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-sfegP4bo0bo/VCbROA91ihI/AAAAAAAAwXw/Z5Y2UQMora0/s1600/imjvdages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purusha ( Brahman /\nmorphogenetic consciousness field&nbsp; ) is\nstatic .&nbsp;&nbsp; Shakti ( Pragati ) is the\ndynamic side of Brahman.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Durga is the destroyer\nform of Shakti. &nbsp;&nbsp;Durga is a form of\nParvati, the wife of Lord Shiva, the destroyer God. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lHfiEFOiYOs/VCbfW3cpLVI/AAAAAAAAwYY/ECMkpeYHYTU/s1600/durga-slgwukthas.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lHfiEFOiYOs/VCbfW3cpLVI/AAAAAAAAwYY/ECMkpeYHYTU/s1600/durga-slgwukthas.jpg\" width=\"336\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Durga\nkilled Mahishasura after 9 days of &nbsp;intense battle, triggering off the Navratri\ncelebrations.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In each cycle of\ncreation, Purusha ( Brahman) enters into Prakriti ( Shakti ) and this union\nunfolds as the cosmos.&nbsp;&nbsp; In the pralaya\nor dissolution at the end of the cosmic cycle or Kalpa,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; all creation withdraws into the now\nformless Prakriti.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prakriti expresses\nHerself through the three gunas ( tamas/ sattva / rajas--&nbsp; - creator/ preserver / destroyer ) , the\nthreads or qualities of all creation. Unlike Prakriti, the Purusha is only a\nDrashta or Sakshi (witness) of events in this universe. It merely plays the\nrole of a spectator and does not create anything.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This aspect could be compared to a prism,\nwhich emits myriad colors only when light is passed through it.&nbsp; Purusha is always unchanging in nature and\nhence, it is Achala or static.&nbsp; Prakriti,\non the contrary, constantly creates changes in this universe, hence is the\ndynamic one. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva and Shakti are the\nbasics of the entire Tantra philosophy.&nbsp; &nbsp;It is NOT perverted sex as the immoral white historian wrote over brandy and cigars.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In essence Shiva and Shakti are undifferentiated unity. &nbsp;In Tantra,\nconsciousness is called Shiva, and manifestation, which is energy /power, is\ncalled Shakti.&nbsp; &nbsp;Prakriti ( Shakti )\ncannot be perceived, not because of its non-existence, but because of its\nsubtlety.&nbsp; It is perceived in its\neffects. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the insentient Prakriti\n( female \u2013Dvaita ) comes in contact with the sentient Purusha (male \u2013Advaita )\n, the universe evolves.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LmNBbKblOr8/VCbfHnsm-LI/AAAAAAAAwYQ/lmdI0RMlmqs/s1600/imageouyF3s%2B(70).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LmNBbKblOr8/VCbfHnsm-LI/AAAAAAAAwYQ/lmdI0RMlmqs/s1600/imageouyF3s%2B(70).jpg\" width=\"398\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not only is\nShakti responsible for creation, it is also the agent of all change It is a\ntantric symbol symbolizing two triangles representing Shakti from below merging\ninto Shiva .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This symbol ( six point star formed by two enmeshed triangles ) was\nused by the disgraced Kerala Namboodiris who founded Judaism.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-iDG8twFqhhI/VCbejO49OsI/AAAAAAAAwYI/ReQdoOKY2YY/s1600/shiva-shnnakti.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-iDG8twFqhhI/VCbejO49OsI/AAAAAAAAwYI/ReQdoOKY2YY/s1600/shiva-shnnakti.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti awakens,\ngoes up Sushumna nadi and unites with Shiva in Sahasrara chakra. Shiva\nrepresents the higher cosmic consciousness and Shakti represents evolution of\nenergy. Kundalini yoga is based on this concept.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This image represents a\ntransgendered entity, which depicts how the female principle of Goddess Shakti\nis inseparable from the male principle of Lord Shiva. Both the Shaktas\n(devotees of Shakti) and the Shaivas (devotees of Shiva) of the Tantra school\nof thought believe in the Divine Unity of Shakti with Shiva as the Ultimate\nTruth..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ardha-Nari, which\nliterally means, \"half-woman\", is the Soul of the tiny atom to the\nvast cosmos.&nbsp;&nbsp;All creation starts from\nHim.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Juo08aJXomU/VCbea3Lr6AI/AAAAAAAAwYA/TLFJa_sq7tE/s1600/Ardhanarishvara_at_Sampurnasnjjiand_Sanskrit_University.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Juo08aJXomU/VCbea3Lr6AI/AAAAAAAAwYA/TLFJa_sq7tE/s1600/Ardhanarishvara_at_Sampurnasnjjiand_Sanskrit_University.jpg\" width=\"410\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Life is created from\nHim and death is considered as a return back to His Kingdom, only to emerge yet\nagain clothed in another body.&nbsp; Hence,\nthere is no perishing of any creature - it is all only a part of a much larger\nprocess of the cycle of life itself.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though Shakti is not co-existent with Purusha, ( Shiva ), she requires\nhis presence to keep the cosmos functioning smoothly.&nbsp;&nbsp; Shiva ( Purusha/ brahmAn ) , though he\nwields unlimited power, he cannot create the universe without the Eternal Life\nForce of Shakti to back him.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The concept of\nArdhanarishvara clearly brings out the fact that Prakriti (Shakti) and Purusha\n(Shiva) are nothing without each other and one cannot exist and function in the\nabsence of the other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantras are the ancient\nscriptures, which were meant to spread the light of knowledge of our True Self\nand bring humanity out of ignorance.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThey trace their origin from the Vedas and the Upanishads, and in fact\ndo not deviate from the teachings contained in them. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0lE-PiJPew8/VCbgGMnHorI/AAAAAAAAwYg/UpGm1XeBLpo/s1600/hhh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"370\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0lE-PiJPew8/VCbgGMnHorI/AAAAAAAAwYg/UpGm1XeBLpo/s1600/hhh.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like Vedanta, Tantra\nhas its own followers in the true spirit of inquiry and realization of the\ncosmic unity and power of the Self.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unfortunately, Tantras\nwere tainted with such practices as 'erotic mysticism' and 'black magic'..by\nthe white invader eager to convert Hindus to Christianity\u2014using their FAKE\nMutts and Indian stooges, like Raja Ram Mohan Roy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have been to the\nexact spot where Durga killed Mahishasura ( Mookasura ) as revealed by Adi\nShankaracharya .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>KUDAJADRI MOUNTAIN ADI SHANKARACHARYA 2000 BC &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the base of\nKudajadri mountain lies Maranakatte ( Moolasthana ) , &nbsp;where Durga (Devi ) had killed the demon\nMookasura, and you can see the 35 feet handle end of the metal trident spear\nsticking out.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-vllh0_XXQu0/VCbt3JkaaPI/AAAAAAAAwYw/0hhJVwBnnQs/s1600/mahishasurmardddini.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-vllh0_XXQu0/VCbt3JkaaPI/AAAAAAAAwYw/0hhJVwBnnQs/s1600/mahishasurmardddini.jpg\" width=\"300\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian scientists from NITK, Suratkal\nconducted a test on this spear&nbsp; and found\nthat it was made from traditional Indian metallurgical skills.&nbsp; Nobody knows the composition of the alloy yet\nas the spear has NOT rusted despite being more than 4000 years old.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before Durga fought\ndemon Mahishasura , she was empowered by the Hindu god trinity of Brahma, Shiva\nand Vishnu.&nbsp; She battled for nine\ndays&nbsp; and on the tenth day vanquished the\nevil demon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mookambika &nbsp;temple consecrated by Adi Shankaracharya 4000\nyears ago, &nbsp;is my wife\u2019s favourite temple\nas she says it emits powerful vibes . &nbsp;He\nalso installed the Sri Yantra there.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1H4IX9AEHqo/VCb3t5cpHXI/AAAAAAAAwZ8/CXiBYgf5n1I/s1600/0iop.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1H4IX9AEHqo/VCb3t5cpHXI/AAAAAAAAwZ8/CXiBYgf5n1I/s1600/0iop.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>SRI YANTRA ,108 AND\nTHEORY OF EVERYTHING VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Jv4kCx7Ikto/VCb303DQKQI/AAAAAAAAwaE/kJaUO3Zknvo/s1600/imagesCAwwMWQTF4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Jv4kCx7Ikto/VCb303DQKQI/AAAAAAAAwaE/kJaUO3Zknvo/s1600/imagesCAwwMWQTF4.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mookambika Devi is\nunique among the Hindu gods and goddesses as she embodies the powers of Laksmi\n( wife of Vishnu) Saraswati ( wife of Brahma ) and Parvati ( wife of Shiva ) merged\ninto one as Adiparashakthi.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-N7jIM0nhxhA/VCb1PfpbC4I/AAAAAAAAwZY/NrUNHfFVoU0/s1600/Durga_by_EnfncderDeHell.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-N7jIM0nhxhA/VCb1PfpbC4I/AAAAAAAAwZY/NrUNHfFVoU0/s1600/Durga_by_EnfncderDeHell.jpg\" width=\"464\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nHere is the lore-<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Long ago , the mighty Asura king Mahishasura was granted the boon\nof immortality by Shiva, through extreme tapasya ( penance ) .&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva was so pleased with Mahishasura\u2019s\ndevotion, that he blessed him with eternal life, declaring that no man, beast,\ndemon or deity would ever be able to kill him. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahishasura, having received Shiva\u2019s boon, now\nconsidered himself invincible and started a reign of terror and conquest of the\nthree lokas.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Slaying and killing mercilessly, he and his\narmy of demons soon conquered earth, and set their eyes upon Devaloka, the\nabode of the Devas. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-D5FK15EnW6A/VCb3dNk_4YI/AAAAAAAAwZ0/LxfJ8sb7n7I/s1600/dhhurga.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"472\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-D5FK15EnW6A/VCb3dNk_4YI/AAAAAAAAwZ0/LxfJ8sb7n7I/s1600/dhhurga.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahishasura\nattacked the Gods, and in a ferocious battle seized Devaloka, driving out\nIndra and the Devas. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He grabed the\nthrone of Indra and declared himself to be the new ruler.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><b>Below: Dane Quantum Scientist and Nobel Prize winner, &nbsp;Neils Bohr converted to Hinduism and was cremated .</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GkHSLAsr4yc/VCdsjYFzkVI/AAAAAAAAwas/HqLp-l2Ymyg/s1600/imWW2ages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GkHSLAsr4yc/VCdsjYFzkVI/AAAAAAAAwas/HqLp-l2Ymyg/s1600/imWW2ages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Devas hurried to\nseek the aid of Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva, who were not pleased to hear of\nMahishasura\u2019s deeds. The stories of Mahishasura\u2019s violent conquest enraged the\nthree to such a degree that a light of anger sprang out of Brahma, Vishnu and\nShiva. The display of anger from the three sent out a light, which illuminated\nthe three worlds and combined to take the beautiful form of the Goddess Durga.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zvzn6bLnasA/VCb0c0eGooI/AAAAAAAAwZQ/VID7q-P0dig/s1600/maa-duuurga-34.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zvzn6bLnasA/VCb0c0eGooI/AAAAAAAAwZQ/VID7q-P0dig/s1600/maa-duuurga-34.jpg\" width=\"548\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahishasura in his arrogance had not\nconsidered that a woman could be of any threat, but Shiva, having given\nMahishasura his boon, knew that he was only protected against animals, men and\nGods, and that a woman, a Devi, with the boons and powers of the three would be\nable to slay the demon and restore balance and prosperity to the worlds.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/--6dWbXjJpUg/VCb2ncFnBCI/AAAAAAAAwZo/CZWii8Iv_vw/s1600/imayyyges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/--6dWbXjJpUg/VCb2ncFnBCI/AAAAAAAAwZo/CZWii8Iv_vw/s1600/imayyyges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Mahishasura saw\nDurga on the battlefield, he fell in love instantly, enthralled by her beauty,\nhe proposed to marry her. Durga agreed, but on one condition, Mahishasura would\nhave to defeat her in battle.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0gEAJgRYr-M/VCb0NMegeZI/AAAAAAAAwZI/GcUUTVSdo9E/s1600/imttages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"301\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0gEAJgRYr-M/VCb0NMegeZI/AAAAAAAAwZI/GcUUTVSdo9E/s1600/imttages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then began a fierce\nbattle between the two and their armies of Devas and Asuras, the fighting\ncontinued for nine days and nights with much gore and destruction. &nbsp;&nbsp;Finally on the tenth day, Durga had the upper\nhand and Mahishasura, desperately trying to avoid defeat, transformed into a\nwild buffalo.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WfnWcMh_sk0/VCbzuwdM59I/AAAAAAAAwZA/q2Ptor6BaxQ/s1600/DP251ff642.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WfnWcMh_sk0/VCbzuwdM59I/AAAAAAAAwZA/q2Ptor6BaxQ/s1600/DP251ff642.jpg\" width=\"479\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Durga pinned him to the ground with her left leg, Mahishasura\nshape shifted back to his human form and leapt up. &nbsp;Durga pierced his chest with her trishul and\nswiftly beheaded Mahishasura with her sword, liberating both man and Gods of\nthe terrible demon and restoring peace and balance to the worlds.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Z5l3SvRzyxk/VCb2KqZM_SI/AAAAAAAAwZg/4KcutyEddfI/s1600/durga-mahhhisa.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Z5l3SvRzyxk/VCb2KqZM_SI/AAAAAAAAwZg/4KcutyEddfI/s1600/durga-mahhhisa.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus Durga was given\nthe name Mahishasura Mardini, the slayer of Mahishasura.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-uK6IKsxcMKU/VCgsg-r1eMI/AAAAAAAAwdQ/p86un6sDED8/s1600/imagjkigtes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-uK6IKsxcMKU/VCgsg-r1eMI/AAAAAAAAwdQ/p86un6sDED8/s1600/imagjkigtes.jpg\" width=\"330\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nine nights have\ncome to be known as Navratri, while the tenth day is called Vijayadashmi, the\nday that brought the triumph of good over evil.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FaAMoRHmv48/VCcAM0ADmyI/AAAAAAAAwaU/zsjj1M3WDZA/s1600/imag60-%3Des.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"379\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FaAMoRHmv48/VCcAM0ADmyI/AAAAAAAAwaU/zsjj1M3WDZA/s1600/imag60-%3Des.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;
