margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IsRJjTvnCd4/VCe0XKOjr2I/AAAAAAAAwcQ/KWqjWUoTIVg/s1600/dowwwnload.jpg\" width=\"294\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Hindu women fast during the nine days of Navratri. &nbsp; There is NO hard and fast rule for fasting. &nbsp; People &nbsp;change from non-vegetarian to vegetarian diet . &nbsp; Navratri Vrat is about accepting some rigid self discipline and sticking to it. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Married couple abstain from sex. &nbsp; &nbsp;People when they want to even TURN OVER A NEW LEAF , do a vrat as a ritual. It is a thousand times more stronger than a bullshit new year resolution. &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">This is always a goal in mind. It is about harnessing your meandering mind , which aids self focus to awaken your dormant powers within. &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_n9ILGYuPJA/VCecF1eEWRI/AAAAAAAAwbs/DcHl_d_b5vA/s1600/dfe2b8da6e08faa4871gew470165657df61.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"316\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_n9ILGYuPJA/VCecF1eEWRI/AAAAAAAAwbs/DcHl_d_b5vA/s1600/dfe2b8da6e08faa4871gew470165657df61.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Gratitude , non-violence, love, truth , unselfishness, sacrifice, grace, honesty form the warp and weft of this vrat fabric. &nbsp;Optimism , courage , perseverance , contemplation and fortitude form the fibre.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">There are no cheaters. &nbsp;Nobody monitors, as it is about your own mind cleansing. &nbsp;Hindus abstain from alcohol, cigarettes, foul language and &nbsp;lack of discipline.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Men do NOT shave or cut their hair, to remind them of their vrat and their determination &nbsp;keep away from worldly objects of pleasure, and NOT to hurt the feelings of others.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">People visit the temple on all 9 days.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KchPxzuq6l8/VCeb6oRPLEI/AAAAAAAAwbk/NC2T9w8SR_Q/s1600/101410065vds104Rani-Mukherkee-141010-BP-04.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KchPxzuq6l8/VCeb6oRPLEI/AAAAAAAAwbk/NC2T9w8SR_Q/s1600/101410065vds104Rani-Mukherkee-141010-BP-04.jpg\" width=\"265\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Below: Check out the immoral attack on Hinduism -- &nbsp;it is in the middle of Durga Puja -- an <b><span style=\"color: blue;\">EMPOWERED</span></b> married Hindu woman and a stranger.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/B14tSO9DyR8/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/B14tSO9DyR8&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/B14tSO9DyR8&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vrat is NOT mere\nabstaining from&nbsp; food . &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vrat helps\nyou to prepare the mind for meditation and contemplation--rather observing\nyourself inwards. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a kid, Ayudha Puja\nwas my favourite festival--and ditto for every single child of Kerala.&nbsp;&nbsp; From the evening of Ashtami , the eight day\ntill the morning of the Vijaya Dashami tenth day, we are forbidden from\ntouching our books.&nbsp;&nbsp; One token book\nwould be sent to the the local temple and the rest stacked up in the puja room\nof the house.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every body including\nadults cannot touch their tools on the 9th day ( Maha navami ) Ayudha puja<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is kept for worship\non the altar of the divine. If one can make a conscious effort to see the\nDivine in the tools and objects one uses each day, it will help one to see\none's work as an offering to God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This means on the 10th\nday there will be no newspaper in the morning. The diety is Saraswati, the\nGoddess of learning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 10th auspicious day\nis called Vijaya Dashimi. On the morning after a bath, the books or tools have\nto be taken out and used. Both my children at the age of three was initiated\ninto the world of letters on this day morning--after the nine days if Navratri.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The children of 3 or 5\nare taken to the temple ( or done in the house ) for the Vidyarambham ceremony,\nas a unique annual ritual.&nbsp; For this\nlearning initiation the child is made to sit on the lap of the parents or\ngrandparents in front of the picture or statue of Goddess Saraswati.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mantra \"Om\nHari Shree Ganapathaye Namah\"(</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;kartika&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0d13\u0d02</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;kartika&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0d39\u0d30\u0d3f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;kartika&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0d36\u0d4d\u0d30\u0d40</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;kartika&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0d17\u0d23\u0d2a\u0d24\u0d2f\u0d47</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;kartika&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0d28\u0d2e\u0d03</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)\nis written on the tongue of the child with a gold ring dipped in honey and\nvayampu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6Dilx4OKkmI/VCezH8wiVwI/AAAAAAAAwb8/Knxuah6ltis/s1600/cvwwb.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"269\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6Dilx4OKkmI/VCezH8wiVwI/AAAAAAAAwb8/Knxuah6ltis/s1600/cvwwb.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then the child is made\nto write the same thing in rice on a flat platter made of bell metal, with the\nright index finger ,uttering each syllable as it is written--prompted by the\nelder hand.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the\nkindergarden schools start on Vijaya Dashami day in Kerala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the 8th , 9th and\n10th days thousands throng in Kerala temples. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me visualise what\nall my wife kept in the puja room for Ayudha Puja .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Saraswati picture on a white cloth, flowers,\nmango leaves, turmeric, kumkum, puffed and beaten rice, few seasonal fruits\nincluding plantains, conch, burning incense--etc&nbsp; .&nbsp; Our\nprasadam was Pradhaman payasam made of jaggery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><i><b>Below: Goddess of learning Saraswati . We have the richest culture on this planet ! &nbsp;We are jealous of none !!</b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-s44e97tFSos/VCezuDKR7VI/AAAAAAAAwcE/Kibqp_y6XbQ/s1600/saraswwwati.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"593\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-s44e97tFSos/VCezuDKR7VI/AAAAAAAAwcE/Kibqp_y6XbQ/s1600/saraswwwati.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Navratri 2014 begins on\nSeptember 25 and ends on October 3 2014.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During Navratri a kalash\nis placed in the Puja room.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Kalash is prepared at\nhome and the water is changed daily for nine days. &nbsp;The kalash is placed on grains on raised\nplatform or in the Puja room.<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One diya is lit close\nto this Kalash which is supposed to burn endlessly for nine days. This is known\nas Akhand Jyoti.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>KALASHA , SYMBOL OF THE\nCOSMIC WOMB&nbsp; VADAKAYIL</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Navratri is a time for\nSPRING CLEANING of the entire house, giving away unwanted things to poor people\nand discarding useless things. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindus clean their\nhomes for inviting the Goddess Shakti into their homes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hoarding of usless\ngarbage in the homes like old clothes, shoes, &nbsp;plastic bottles,&nbsp;magazines etc &nbsp;is an effort to manage the anxiety raised by\nobsessive doubts.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There will be&nbsp; a disruption to feelings of self-worth,\ninterpersonal relationships, occupation, or health as a result of hoarding\nitems which are worthless.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hoarders experience\nintense anxiety when they even think of discarding what most others view as\nuseless objects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are affected by\nanxiety-provoking thoughts such as: \"What if I run out?\" &nbsp;\"What if I need to know something and\ndon't have the information available?\" \" &nbsp;\"What if I throw it away but the day\ncomes when I really need it?\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hoarders are suspicious\nof other people touching possessions , as they feel it may be thrown away ,\nwhen they are not around.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Being overly\nsentimental does not bring happiness---that storing up stuff only brings\nmisery, chaos, and isolation. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All\nhoarders firmly believe that every single object will be useful one day,\nwhether it is a broken toy, old magazine, torn ill fitting shoes, empty\ncontainer, plastic bag , old tooth brushes, old school notebooks, old\ndamaged&nbsp; music tapes .. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;They will have FALTHU imaginary emotional\nconnection to all such garbage. Hoarders make themselves miserable and and\neveryone else miserable. &nbsp;&nbsp;Remember,\nthere is NO medicine for treating hoarding. This OCD is due to bad programming\nin your genes. &nbsp;You need to wipe out the\nblue print and insert a healthy one. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Navratri teaches you about\nletting go first and then changing for the better. &nbsp;You can never learn, unless you unlearn.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ANpW8kFk8Ns/VCfU0GWgrfI/AAAAAAAAwcg/73E6I56IILQ/s1600/landing-page-hoarwwders.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ANpW8kFk8Ns/VCfU0GWgrfI/AAAAAAAAwcg/73E6I56IILQ/s1600/landing-page-hoarwwders.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 10<sup>th</sup> day\nis Vijayadashami and marks the &nbsp;victory\nof Goddess Durga over the demons Mahishasura.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FAKE mutts of the white\ninvader created all these Ram\u2019s victory over Ravan events on Dusshera\u2014on the\nsame day.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why not ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader\nquotes verses from a whole lot of FAKE DASAS who never existed -- Kalidas\u2019s\nRaghuvans, Tulsidas\u2019s Ram Charit Manas, Keshavdas's Ram Chandra Yas Chandrika\netc <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">The white invader\ncaused the BR Ambedkarite people in India celebrate this festival as Ashok\nVijayadashmi, since the Mauryan Emperor Asoka converted from <span style=\"color: red;\">BAAD BAAD Hindusim </span>to <span style=\"color: blue;\">GOODIE GOOD Buddhism</span> on this day. </b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ashoka never existed !&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nobody heard of Ashoka till the white invader\ncame to India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Taking a cue BR.\nAmbedkar converted from BAAD BAAD Hindusim to GOODIE GOOD Buddhism on this day at Deekshabhoomi, Nagpur in 1956,\nwhich fell on 14 October in that year.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gudi Padwa ( first day\nof Chaitra Navratri in March / April )&nbsp; was\nunknown before the white invader came to India\u2014and was celebrated first by\nChitpavan Brahmins .&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; color: blue;\">UPSIDE\nDOWN </span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">on a pole -- </span><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">rather &nbsp;<span style=\"color: purple;\">IMPALED </span>by a pole from the bottom</span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> -- and converted to the flag of Brahma ( sic ) !! , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me wash my hands as\na ritual !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Goddess Shakti (\nbhagwati ) was being worshiped in Kerala thousands of years before Lord\nParashurama came 6000 years ago.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A whole chapter in the\ntenth mandal of the Rigveda 5000 BC,&nbsp;\naddresses the devotional sadhanas of Goddess Shakti.&nbsp;&nbsp; The \"Devi Sukta\" and \"Isha\nSukta\" of the Rigveda and \"Ratri Sukta\" of the Samveda similarly\nsing paeans of praise of sadhanas of Shakti.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Krishna worshipped\nShakti before he set out for the Battle of Mahabharata in 4000 BC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Navratri is also a time\nto connect with the community.&nbsp;\nNeighbours invite each other home to see the display of idols, to sing\nsongs, share food and exchange small gifts.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They gather together in\nthe evenings to singe and do group dance.&nbsp;\nIt\u2019s a vibrant social festival.&nbsp;\nIt\u2019s also a time to explore and socially bond..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; Navratri fast is\nbroken on the ninth day or 'Navami'.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Have you noticed --when animals\nare ill, they lie down and often don't eat or drink.&nbsp; Energy goes towards healing our bodies\ninstead of digesting food. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2e_XRkfPc-Q/VCkuvQObq9I/AAAAAAAAwic/dbf_fORV1ak/s1600/0io8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2e_XRkfPc-Q/VCkuvQObq9I/AAAAAAAAwic/dbf_fORV1ak/s1600/0io8.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fasting is a message to\nyour body that you're embarking on a new beginning, flushing out the old and\nbringing in the new.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tenth day is a time\nto feast and rejoice. There is an air of gratitude. Gratitude has a unique\nrelationship with your mental and physical health. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-PFKGqYWd6hY/VCku1CkfvVI/AAAAAAAAwik/oibMIpVvdtY/s1600/0g8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-PFKGqYWd6hY/VCku1CkfvVI/AAAAAAAAwik/oibMIpVvdtY/s1600/0g8.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grateful people are\nhappier, less stressed and happier with social relationships. Grateful people\nhave better self acceptance and are at peace with themselves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dLAHg4gr-3I/VCku7aRLN8I/AAAAAAAAwis/elEW9xrOyBs/s1600/imagtjes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dLAHg4gr-3I/VCku7aRLN8I/AAAAAAAAwis/elEW9xrOyBs/s1600/imagtjes.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>ALL HINDU GODS , EXCEPT VISHNUs HUMAN AVATARs ( VAMANA/ PARASHURAMA. In all Kaabalishwara temples Shiva is worshipped ?<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kapaleeshwarar_Temple</span><br /><br />The above temple is more than 3000 years old-not 1300 years as told by Wikipedia.<br /><br />The rest of the post is POISON injected by the white invader-<br /><br />QUOTE: The temple's name is derived from the words kapalam (head) and eeshwarar an alias of lord Shiva. According to the Puranas, during the meeting of Brahma and Shiva at top of Mount Kailash Brahma failed to show the due respect to Shiva. Due to this, Shiva plucked of one of Brahma's heads (kapalams). In an act of penance, Brahma came down to the site of Mylapore and installed a Lingam to please Shiva.\u201dUNQUOTE<br /><br />KAPALI is matted hair.<br /><br />STONING OF THE SHAITAN IS NOT A RITUAL THAT MUST BE PERFORMED DURING HAJ PILGRIMAGE AS PER KORAN OR EVEN HADITH<br /><br />AAA- These rituals are acts of worship and must be dedicated to the name of God alone (6:162).<br /><br />WHO HAS TOLD MUSLIMS TO DEDICATE SOMETHING TO THE DEVIL DURING A HOLY PILGRIMAGE -- WITH A NEGATIVE CONNOTATION ? THIS RITUAL NEVER EXISTED IN ANCIENT TIMES -- MOHAMMAD KISSED THE BLACK STONE , HE DID NOT DO THE JAMRAH STONING.<br /><br />There is a black meterorite stone at the SE corner of kaaba 5 feet above the ground- installed by mohammad the prophet himself , with his own hands.<br /><br />BBB-<br />\"Ibn `Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said: \"The Black Stone came down from Jannah (Paradise).\"<br /><br />(At-Tirmidhi, Sunan, hadith no. 877, and classified as authentic hadith by Sheikh Al-Albaani in his book Sahih At-Tirmidthi, hadith no. 695 )<br /><br /><br />CCC-<br /><br />\"Narrated 'Abis bin Rabia: 'Umar came near the Black Stone and kissed it and said \"No doubt, I know that you are a stone and can neither benefit anyone nor harm anyone. Had I not seen Allah's Apostle kissing you I would not have kissed you.\"<br /><br />Sahih Bukhari 2:26:667, also Sahih Bukhari 2:26:657 and Sahih Muslim 7:2912-2915<br /><br />DDD-<br />\"Ibn `Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) quoted the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) as saying: \u201cTouching them both [the Black Stone and Ar-Rukn Al-Yamani] is an expiation for one\u2019s sins.\"<br /><br />(At-Tirmidhi, Sunan, hadith no. 959. This hadith is classified as hasan by At-Tirmidhi and as Sahih by Al-Hakim (1/664), and Adh-Dhahabi agreed with him.)<br /><br />today nobody can touch the black stone due to great crush at a single point. they can only point their hand towards it while doing circum ambulation 7 times anti-clockwise. ( pradikshanam )<br /><br /><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">STONING OF THE DEVIL IS NOT IN THE KORAN OR IN ANY ORIGINAL HADITH . MOHAMMAD HAD NOT DONE IT.<br /><br />ANY MUSLIM EVER KNOWN THE EFFORT TAKEN TO STONE THE DEVIL-- MORE TIME IS CONSUMED IN NEGATIVITY THAN POSITIVISM TOWARDS ALLAH.<br /><br /><br />IF A MUSLIM TREATS A STONE PILLAR AS THE DEVIL -- IS THIS NOT IDOLATRY? .<br /><br />HAS KORAN PERMITTED IDOLATORY?<br /><br />STONING OF THE PAGAN TRINITY WAS STARTED SEVERAL CENTURIES LATER -INTRODUCED BY CRYPTO JEWS.</span></b><br /><br /><br />No human has the power or ability to see the devil or to be able to inflict him with any harm.<br /><br />EEE-<br />\"O children of Adam, do not let the devil entice you just like he caused your parents to be evicted from Paradise, stripping them of their garments to expose their private parts to them. He and his tribe see you from where you cannot see them.\" 7:27<br /><br />The Quran emphasises that the only duty of believers in the Hajj is to commemorate the name of God. The various verses that speak of Hajj in the Quran constantly emphasises this sole purpose of Hajj:<br /><br />CONTINUED TO 3--</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_117MN\" kind=\"m\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_117BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; Then he would go ahead until he reached the level ground where he would stand facing the qiblah, and he stood for a long time, offering du\u2019aa\u2019 and raising his hands. Then he would stone the middle pillar, then he would move to the left towards the middle ground, where he would stand facing the qiblah. He would remain there for a long time offering du\u2019aa\u2019 and raising his hands. Then he would stone Jamarat al-\u2018Aqabah from the middle of the valley, but he did not stand beside it. Then he would leave and say: This is how I saw the Prophet doing it. ----Narrated by al-Bukhaari (1751)\u2026<br /><br />ALMOST ALL TOP MUSLIM CLERGY TODAY GET JEWISH FUNDS.. line-height: 150%;\">Indian Vedic astrology does NOT use Uranus (Shweta ) Neptune ( Shyama)\nPluto ( Teevra )- as named in 7000 year old Vedas by Vyasa Muni , just because\nthey are too far away to affect your DNA and they stay in one single rashi for\ntoo long.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kEnJJ-xnSmY/VCJTFGdHmfI/AAAAAAAAwQs/ThTf62PVMNM/s1600/mars-insideere.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kEnJJ-xnSmY/VCJTFGdHmfI/AAAAAAAAwQs/ThTf62PVMNM/s1600/mars-insideere.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"584\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For travel to outer\nplanets, like Mars, the periapsis (closest point in the orbit) must coincide\nwith Earth\u2019s orbit, while apoapsis must coincide with Mar\u2019s orbit. &nbsp;The Mars Orbiter Mission (MOM) by the Indian\nSpace Research Organization used this Hohmann transfer orbit as its trajectory\nto reach Mars. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GKUCP4LEeGY/VCJZEOvndPI/AAAAAAAAwRY/ahK8dAgpLKE/s1600/maCDErs.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GKUCP4LEeGY/VCJZEOvndPI/AAAAAAAAwRY/ahK8dAgpLKE/s1600/maCDErs.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since the satellite is in\nheliocentric trajectory, the fuel is not used in this travel. &nbsp;Fuel is used only to enter the Hohmann\ntransfer orbit from earth and to exit the transfer orbit to enter&nbsp; martian orbit. &nbsp;This transfer orbit is thus highly fuel efficient\ncompensating its long travel time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Vy-bQgVnaSI/VCJRxQDlJdI/AAAAAAAAwQM/_HxdURI2Qxg/s1600/368x368x1-300x30ww30.gif.pagespeed.ic.s0maMAxftF.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Vy-bQgVnaSI/VCJRxQDlJdI/AAAAAAAAwQM/_HxdURI2Qxg/s1600/368x368x1-300x30ww30.gif.pagespeed.ic.s0maMAxftF.png\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Hohmann transfer\norbit is an elliptical one, where the periapsis is at Earth's distance from the\nSun and the apoapsis is at Mars' distance from the Sun. &nbsp;The transfer orbit has to be timed so that\nwhen the spacecraft departs Earth, it will arrive at its orbit apoapsis when\nMars is at the same position in its orbit. &nbsp;Earth and Mars align properly for a Hohmann\ntransfer once every 26 months.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-atTGPHvqW_U/VCJR_TPltLI/AAAAAAAAwQU/4JMH6IomzMk/s1600/Mangalyaanflig677htplanSMALL.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-atTGPHvqW_U/VCJR_TPltLI/AAAAAAAAwQU/4JMH6IomzMk/s1600/Mangalyaanflig677htplanSMALL.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our four-stage Polar\nSatellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV) could deliver Mars Orbiter Mission (with a mass\nof 1340 kilograms, fully fueled) to Earth orbit, without any heavy, powerful\nupper stage like Centaur of US.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-BzDnJ3yj2HU/VCJSPPSIklI/AAAAAAAAwQc/xtgoCe2z2SI/s1600/10620573_1554149384808418_8554491ju8756511265866_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-BzDnJ3yj2HU/VCJSPPSIklI/AAAAAAAAwQc/xtgoCe2z2SI/s1600/10620573_1554149384808418_8554491ju8756511265866_n.jpg\" height=\"522\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our Mars Orbiter\nMission got to Mars using its much smaller Liquid Apogee Motor (LAM) and small\namount of fuel \u2013unlike the US Maven ( NASA ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gHMQx-Du5zc/VCJSqE_cm0I/AAAAAAAAwQk/EA1KcwmqVDU/s1600/MAVEN-tddeimeline1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gHMQx-Du5zc/VCJSqE_cm0I/AAAAAAAAwQk/EA1KcwmqVDU/s1600/MAVEN-tddeimeline1.jpg\" height=\"336\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methane (CH4) is an\norganic molecule present in gaseous form in the Earth's atmosphere. More than\n90% of methane on our home planet is produced by living organisms. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After almost a year of\nsearching, NASA's Curiosity rover has turned up no traces of the four-pronged\nhydrocarbon known as methane.&nbsp; However India\nexpects to find methane on mars\u2014a &nbsp;methane sensor will look for sources of the\ngas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methane has a chemical\nlifetime of about 300-600 years, which is very short on geological time scales.\nThis implies that the methane that is observed today cannot have been produced\n4.5 billion years ago, when the planets formed.&nbsp;\nSo, it is possible that methanogenes, existing deep under the surface of\nMars.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><i>Below: 6 years ago , India &nbsp;\"impact probed\" her flag on the moon&nbsp;</i></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><i><br /></i></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-caDhR6tSQbE/VCJmVSyaTEI/AAAAAAAAwSM/sYR4DjVv7-w/s1600/chandraddeyaan.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Using data collected by\nIndia\u2019s Chandrayaan mission, NASA had detected magmatic water locked under the\nsurface of the Moon, for the first time .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before India, various\ncountries have launched Mars missions, but out of the 51 attempts, only 21 were\nsuccessful. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;India now joins the\nMartian club that comprises the US, Russia and the European Space Agency<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; The density at Venus is extreme. Structural requirements for a plane would be difficult to achieve. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In less than a year , India\nwill be the sixth nation on this planet to have her own GPS system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On April 4 2014, we launched\n&nbsp;the second navigation satellite which\nwill provide an indigenous alternative to the United States\u2019 Global Positioning\nSystem (GPS) by 2015.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the seven satellite IRNSS program becomes fully\noperational by 2016, it will not only positively impact the lives of common\nIndians but will also be a strategic game-changer with its immense defense,\nsecurity and counter-terrorism applications. IRNSS satellites would revolve\nround the earth at the height of about 36,000 kilometers from the earth's\nsurface. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">It will have a highly accurate\nRubidium atomic clock is part of the navigation payload of the satellite.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirbhay is India\u2019s long\nrange, subsonic cruise missile. It has &nbsp;stealth and very high accuracy. The missile\nhas a range of more than 1000 km \u2013how much more it is a secret . It weighs\nabout one tonne and has a length of 6 metres. &nbsp;It carries a ring laser gyroscope for\nhigh-accuracy navigation and a radio altimeter for the height determination. It\nis capable of being launched from multiple platforms on land, sea and air .It\nis adapted for the Indo/Russian Su-30MKI. The missile is capable of carrying\nnuclear warheads.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-K5j0Fg44xg8/VEEoWAAduWI/AAAAAAAAxKM/CL47VvsFzcM/s1600/Nirbhay-mddissile.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-K5j0Fg44xg8/VEEoWAAduWI/AAAAAAAAxKM/CL47VvsFzcM/s1600/Nirbhay-mddissile.jpg\" height=\"211\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n\n\n\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%; text-align: left;\">Nirbhay is able to pick\nout a target and attack it among multiple targets. The missile has a loitering\ncapability, i.e., it can go round a target and perform several manoeuvres and\nthen re-engage it. With two side wings, the missile is capable of flying at\ndifferent altitudes ranging from 500 m to 4 km above the ground and can also\nfly at low altitudes to avoid detection by enemy radar.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; LIES MOST FOUL &nbsp;-- A HEART PUNCH ON HINDUSIM !<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dkDFgUC5Jj4/VBpJexj686I/AAAAAAAAv7Q/AptJzHHy8BA/s1600/aghoritamreshbabaspecialist-in-vashikaran-and-sifli-nuri-hajuri-ilmRRRH-horoscopes-astrology-occult-science-black-m_1%2BRitual%2BAghori%2BSadhus.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"422\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dkDFgUC5Jj4/VBpJexj686I/AAAAAAAAv7Q/AptJzHHy8BA/s1600/aghoritamreshbabaspecialist-in-vashikaran-and-sifli-nuri-hajuri-ilmRRRH-horoscopes-astrology-occult-science-black-m_1%2BRitual%2BAghori%2BSadhus.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">QUOTE: &nbsp; Aghori Sadhu is\nassociated with cannibalism and rituals using human skulls and animal\nsacrifices. &nbsp;Aghoris are distinguished from other Hindu sects by their\nalcoholic and cannibalistic rituals. &nbsp;A\nplace considered dreadful by others is home for Aghoris, the Hindu cremation\nground. The term \u201cAghori\u201d is derived from the Sanskrit word \u2013 \u201cAghor\u201d. Aghor\nmeans not to forget or non-terrible in one perspectives. It also means absence\nof darkness. Aghor implies a simple and natural state of consciousness in which\nthere is no fear or disgust. Aghoris have rituals that are seen as repulsive\nand feared by common people. As for the Aghori sect, the true meaning of the\nterm Aghori is the one who is fearless and who does not discriminate. The\nAghori are Shaivites, ascetic sadhus devoted to Shiva. They believe the Hindu\ngod of transformation through death and destruction is the Supreme Being,\nembracing death and devoting their lives to living in filth. They often live in\nor near cremation sites, covering themselves in ashes of the dead, and use\nbones to make bowls and jewelry. Human remains for the Aghori rituals are\ngathered from the sacred Ganges river, where the ashes and bones of cremated\ndead are thrown. Still today, the bodies of holy men, pregnant women, people\nbitten by snakes, people who have committed suicide, the poor, and children\nunder 5 are not cremated at the ghats but weighted down in the Ganges. The\nbodies eventually come loose and float down the river. Their worship methodology\nis gruesome and do not get surprised if you happen to see them indulging in\nimpurities. The whole purpose of their tantras, mantras and practices is to\nattain non-duality and self-realization in life. The flesh is eaten raw or\ncooked over an open flame. Drinking alcohol from a human skull, known as\nkapala, is another common tradition in Aghori ritual.. They are unclean most of\nthe time bathed with ash and mostly roam about without clothes. The Aghoris\nweapon is a human skull that they hold in the left hand and a bell in the\nright. Being devotees of Shiva they often chant powerful mantras for attaining\nmoksha - liberation from the cycle of life and death. A tilak on their forehead\nand a chanting rosary made of bones is another limelight. Tourists from around\nthe world come to India to see and believe the Aghori culture. Aghoris have\nattracted so many philosophers and researchers to make documentaries, movies\nand write books as well.&nbsp; &nbsp;Although akin to the Kapalika ascetics of\nmedieval Kashmir, as well as the Kalamukhas, with whom there may be a historical\nconnection, the Aghoris trace their origin to Kina Ram, an ascetic who is said\nto have lived 150 years, dying during the second half of the 18th century.\nDattatreya the avadhuta, to whom has been attributed the esteemed non-dual\nmedieval song, the Avadhuta Gita, was a founding adi guru of the Aghor\ntradition. Baba Keenaram was held to be an incarnation of Shiva, as have been\neach of his successors. Aghoris also hold sacred the Lord Dattatreya as a\npredecessor to the Aghori Tantric tradition. Dattatreya was believed to be an\nincarnation of Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva. Dattatreya is revered in all schools\nof Tantrism, which is the philosophy followed by the Aghora tradition, and he\nis often depicted in Hindu artwork and its holy scriptures of folk narratives,\nthe Puranas, indulging in Aghori \"left-hand\" Tantric worship as his\nprime practice. In Hindu iconography, Tara, like Kali, is one of the ten\nMahavidyas (wisdom goddesses) and once invoked can bless the Aghori with\nsupernatural powers.. The life of an Aghori Sadhu is not easy, to become like\nthem one has to meditate about twelve years and complete certain rituals under\nthe guidance of an Aghori guru in order to enhance one spiritual strength.\nAghoris use woods from pyre, clothes from dead bodies, and ash of burnt bodies\nfor the various rituals. There are certain rules one must follow to become an\naghori. Firstly an Aghori must find a teacher and do what the teacher tells him\nto do. And Aghori must find a human skull known as \u201ckappala\u201d. And use only this\nas a ritual tool before initiation. An Aghori must apply pyre on his body to\nsymbolically show the nature of the Lord Shiva. The final part of ritual\nrequires eating of rotten human flesh and also meditating sitting on a dead\ncorpse. It symbolizes the rise from Savak (human nature) to Siva. Many of the\nAghoris roam around naked representing the true human form and their detachment\nfrom the world of mortals who according to them live in the world of illusion (\u201cmaya\u201d\nin Sanskrit).. Aghories belief the God exists in everything so nothing is\nunholy or inauspicious, but everything is sacred. They believe true Aghori\nshould break all ties with families, friends and all earthly possessions and\nshould live entire life at the cremation ground and eat and drink only through\nthe human skull. In Hinduism, \u201cthere is no evil, everything is emanated from\n\u2018Brahman\u2019, so how could anything in this universe be impure\u201d? This is the kind\nof philosophy the aghori babas follow. According to them everything is the\nmanifestation of god itself, so everything is as pure, so abandoning anything\nis like abandoning god itself. Hinglaj Mata is the Kuladevata (patron goddess)\nof the Aghori. The main Aghori pilgrimage centre is Kina Ram's hermitage or\nashram in Ravindrapuri, Varanasi. The full name of this place is Baba Keenaram\nSthal, Krim-Kund. Here, Kina Ram is buried in a tomb or samadhi which is a\ncentre of pilgrimage for Aghoris and Aghori devotees. Present head (Abbot),\nsince 1978, of Baba Keenaram Sthal is Baba Siddharth Gautam Ram. According to\nDevotees, Baba Siddharth Gautam Ram is reincarnation of Baba Keenaram himself.\nApart from this, any cremation ground would be a holy place for an Aghori\nascetic. The cremation grounds near the yoni pithas, 51 holy centers for\nworship of the Hindu Mother Goddess scattered across South Asia and the\nHimalayan terrain, are key locations preferred for performing sadhana by the\nAghoris. They are also known to meditate and perform sadhana in haunted houses.\nThe Aghori is a human symbol of lord Shiva himself. There have been many\naghoris in the past. Some of them being Dattatreya, Kinaram, Tailanga swamy,\nAghoreshwar Mahaprabhu Baba Bhagwan Ram. Despite their terrifying reputation\nthe Aghori are charitable and have set up a leper colony where they have cared\nfor and cured 99,045 patients with full leprosy and 147,503 with partial\nleprosy. Let\u2019s take a look at some interesting stories of Aghoris... Tailanga\nSwami of Benaras was a very powerful Aghori, and perhaps the only one who\nperformed worship of Shiva at the Kashi Vishwanath temple using his own waste.\nThe priest who saw Tailanga Swami doing such \"things\" slapped him and\nordered him out. On the same night, Shiva appeared in the dream of Benaras\u2019\nking and expressed his anger over the insult of Tailanga Swami, who's Shiva's\nvery essence. The King set out to find the priest and punish him, but the\npriest was mysteriously found dead. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">This is a famous\nfolklore in Madhya Pradesh. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There used to be an old\nBaba in Burhanpur (near Khandwa, MP) whom people used to call Dhuni wale baba.\nThere is a samadhi of Dhune wale baba in Khandwa where people still throng in\nlarge numbers to worship him. He used to stay there, roamed in the adjoining\nareas and use to eat whatever came his way. He used to utter obscenities if\nanyone talked to him or disturbed him even while he seemed to be doing nothing.\nDhuni wale baba used to stare into the sky for hours and talk to himself.\nPeople believed that if he curses you then your problem is bound to get solved.\nThere were many other instances when the Baba uttered obscenities, people used\nto still go behind him. Feared by many, cast out from society and living amongst\nthe dead, these simple holy men represent some of the most extreme forms of\nliving to be found anywhere on the planet.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many people believe\nthat Aghoris are able to transfer pollution and health to and from patients as\na form of \"transformative healing\", due to the believed superior\nstate of body and mind of the Aghori.</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">--UNQUOTE&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/GEpJdHS1pV0/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/GEpJdHS1pV0&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/GEpJdHS1pV0&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Krishna decided to\ngo for a Mexican standoff.&nbsp;&nbsp; he launched\na counter-tapasya&nbsp; and stood before\nher.&nbsp;&nbsp; He stood there for 28 \u2018yugas'.&nbsp;&nbsp; Oh Boy ! TEE HEEEE !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Krishna and\nRukmini would have stood there for longer for several more yugas , but were\nunintentionally intervened by our man Pundalik , the great devotee -- our Jew\nRothschild creation .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serendipity at its very\nbest.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once when Pundalik\u2019s\nparents were sleeping river Bhima made too much noise.&nbsp; This is NOT good OK ? So our man Pundlaika\ncommanded the violent Bhima River not to disturb his sleeping parents.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The river immediately\nmellowed and now flows silently as the Chandrabhaga in Pandharpur. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TEE HEEEEE !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Till today you can find\nLord Vithoba standing on that brick ( was it baked ? ) , waiting to be\nentertained by his 'host', Pundalika of Pandharpur.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild got his\nChitpavan Brahmin stooges to inject into Skanda Purana , the name \u2018Panduranga\u2019\nas a synonym for \u2018Vitthala\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nobody ever heard\nof&nbsp; Vitthala and Pandharpur before the\nChitpavan Jews started re-writing local history\u2014back dating every thing by\nseveral centuries.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every Maharashtrian is\nnow familiar with the term \u2018Varkari\u2019&nbsp;\n.&nbsp; A Varkari is one who\nreligiously performs the vari (pilgrimage) to Pandharpur on foot, especially\nduring the months of Ashadha (mid June to mid July) and Kartika (mid October to\nmid November).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many people go on\npilgrimages, but the term \u2018Varkari\u2019 has got exclusively associated with the\npilgrimage to Pandharpur\u2014as it was made famous by Rothschild stooges .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Vitthala&nbsp; ( Lord Krishna ) was searching for his\nmissing wife Queen Rukmini&nbsp; (who was\nKUTTI with him ) in the deep Dindiravana forest, he bumped into our man\nPundalika.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pundalika was busy\nserving his parents, whom he used to treat like sh#t before .&nbsp;&nbsp; But see now he had turned over a new leaf.\nTEE HEEE !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So he provided a brick\n( was it baked ? ) for Lord Krishna - nay- Vitthala to rest on.(&nbsp; maybe there was ankle deep dirty water around\n?-- beats me ! TEE HEEEEE !)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fEIjNVswpSw/VBtzf04fPnI/AAAAAAAAwCE/AVOZF6MQzUo/s1600/dowtjhtdnddload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"346\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fEIjNVswpSw/VBtzf04fPnI/AAAAAAAAwCE/AVOZF6MQzUo/s1600/dowtjhtdnddload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vitthala stood on the\nbrick and waited patiently for his devotee Pundalika .&nbsp; After completing his services, Pundalika\nprayed to Vitthala and sang his praises and glories. Lord Krishna was pleased\nlike pudding.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So he decideTH to\ngrantETH a boonETH&nbsp; .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pundalika requested\nVitthala \u2018to stay here permanently and lift jivas from ignorance\u2019. (I am\ntouched!) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Krishna \u2013 nay-\nLord Vitthala --nay- Lord Vitthoba --nay- Lord Panduranga happily assented to\nthe loving demands of his devotee Pundlaika .&nbsp;\nHence the place came to be known as Pundarikapur.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild even got his\nstooges to write a back dated Panduranga-shataka-stotra composed by Adi\nShankaracharya ( 2000 BC ) referring to our man Pundlalika .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fake white\nhistorian records that that King Krishnadeva Raya of Vijayanagar had the image\nof Panduranga taken to Hampi, to prevent desecration by Muslim invaders.&nbsp; The absence of the deity sent the whole of\nPandharpur into a pall of gloom gloom&nbsp;\nlike Jughead\u2019s&nbsp; Hot Dog.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
