font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The samhita of Manu\ntakes us from a pinnacle of light to the ultimate end-point of the process\u2014the\ndarkness of Kali Yuga. &nbsp;&nbsp;The 24 petals is\nrepresentative of the 24,000-year period of the Vedic Yuga cycle. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sun itself orbits\naround the galactic center at a radius of about 8,500 parsecs and takes over\n200 million years to make one full orbit.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThis the adjustment Varaha boar ( Vishnu ) made as the Milankovitch\nCycle of 25,765 years that is related to the precession of earth's axis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu Samhita says :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>chatvaaryahu sahsrani\nvarshanaantu kritam yugam<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient seers of\nthe Vedic culture referred to the Galactic Center as Vishnunabhi, or the navel\nof Vishnu. Brahma (Ultimate Creator) sits on a lotus,the symbol of divine\nenergy and divine grace. The lotus grows from the navel of Vishnu, who is the\nsleeping god, whose dream is the universe. . . .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahma opens his eyes (\nEXHALES )and a world comes into being. . . Brahma closes his eyes ( INHALES ) ,\nand a world goes out of being. Lord Vishnu is said to rest in the coils of\nAnanta, the great serpent of Infinity, while he waits for the universe to recreate\nitself.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Well\nwhoever climbs 379 steep winding steps holding a lamp , 5 times daily, will\nsoon die of hernia even if he wears tight undies.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And mind you it would have been &nbsp;higher as 2 storeys &nbsp;6<sup>th</sup> and 7<sup>th</sup> are missing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Q2eMBhCowno/VBE8xg-fToI/AAAAAAAAvyA/sDVK72bgBuY/s1600/2kuttyub.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Q2eMBhCowno/VBE8xg-fToI/AAAAAAAAvyA/sDVK72bgBuY/s1600/2kuttyub.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before 1981, the\ngeneral public could climb to the top up the seven-storey, narrow staircase.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, on 4 December 1981 an accident occurred when an electricity cut\nplunged the tower's staircase into darkness. Around 45 people were killed in\nthe stampede that followed the electricity failure.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the victims were\nchildren because, before 1981, school children were allowed free access to\nhistorical monuments on Fridays, and many school groups were taking advantage\nof this. Subsequently, public access has been forbidden<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><i style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: All broken and installed again by the Muslim invader -- the original exquisite continuity is missing ! &nbsp;Miah Saheb these frescos below are seen in ancient Hindu temples.. they are by no means Islamic motifs .</i></span></b><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qStLl1rATb8/VBE88NyiWRI/AAAAAAAAvyI/EK6Ak-oZECg/s1600/23%2BQutb%2BMinar%2BMosque%2BArabesquee%2Bdetail.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qStLl1rATb8/VBE88NyiWRI/AAAAAAAAvyI/EK6Ak-oZECg/s1600/23%2BQutb%2BMinar%2BMosque%2BArabesquee%2Bdetail.JPG\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first three storeys\nare made of red sandstone; the fourth and fifth storeys are of marble and\nsandstone. The sixth was dismantled, hauled down and re-erected on the lawns\ncloseby ( see below )&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Hl68D6oJcKY/VBE9h8JMw-I/AAAAAAAAvyY/6cHDVEmuQQk/s1600/qeeutb004.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Hl68D6oJcKY/VBE9h8JMw-I/AAAAAAAAvyY/6cHDVEmuQQk/s1600/qeeutb004.jpg\" width=\"275\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 7<sup>th</sup> storey with Brahma on top of a &nbsp;white marble canopy with gold bell patterns\ninlaid is missing.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DGJl5PMl8Yc/VBFAzmYRo7I/AAAAAAAAvzg/3iVS9GaWJe8/s1600/imajgges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DGJl5PMl8Yc/VBFAzmYRo7I/AAAAAAAAvzg/3iVS9GaWJe8/s1600/imajgges.jpg\" width=\"435\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader managed to steal, destroy or poison inject\nmillions of verses of Sanatana Dharma scriptures\u2014but we know .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FZDTUSN31fA/VBE9LxiNitI/AAAAAAAAvyQ/M8hZtOUpkvA/s1600/640px-Ashok33a_Pillar_Delhi.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"632\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FZDTUSN31fA/VBE9LxiNitI/AAAAAAAAvyQ/M8hZtOUpkvA/s1600/640px-Ashok33a_Pillar_Delhi.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bits of Sanskrit inscriptions can still be\ndeciphered in the premises on numerous pillars and walls. The frieze Patterns\non the tower show signs of tampering, ending abruptly or in a medley of\nincongruent lines.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Arabic lettering is interspersed with Hindu motifs like\nlotus buds hanging limp.. The brick red colour ( red ochre ) of the tower is\nsacred to the Hindus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-JEFoCg1LPf0/VBE9vOQUNOI/AAAAAAAAvyg/njp8b4DAQRM/s1600/55858_131e2e289636923976_4917496_o.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-JEFoCg1LPf0/VBE9vOQUNOI/AAAAAAAAvyg/njp8b4DAQRM/s1600/55858_131e2e289636923976_4917496_o.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">24 petal rashi chakra depicts\nthe zodiac . It is a belt of the heavens limited by&nbsp; lines about 8 degrees on either side of the\necliptic or the path of&nbsp; the Sun.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In Hinduism we have 12 signs (\u2018Rashis\u2019),\neach 30\u00b0, of the zodiac&nbsp; and 27\nconstellations, &nbsp;each of 13\u00b0.20\u2019\n(thirteen degrees and twenty&nbsp; minutes).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b>Below: &nbsp; this is the same Hindu motif as on top of the Garuda Yupam ! Aisa kaisa miah saheb ?</b></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vRb-dYN6UyA/VBE98Nmz7QI/AAAAAAAAvyo/hwLiytoRyBg/s1600/a-stone-pillar-with-beahhutiful-carvings-inside-the-qutub-minar-complex-ashish-agarwal.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vRb-dYN6UyA/VBE98Nmz7QI/AAAAAAAAvyo/hwLiytoRyBg/s1600/a-stone-pillar-with-beahhutiful-carvings-inside-the-qutub-minar-complex-ashish-agarwal.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word \u2018Rashi\u2019 (sign) literally means \u2018heap\u2019\nor \u2018cluster\u2019&nbsp; which indicates towards the\ncluster of constellations. There are&nbsp;\ncountless stars in the galaxy. These countless stars which are&nbsp; scattered in the sky have been divided in\ngroups by us for our&nbsp; convenience and\nthen seeing the resemblance of their shapes, they&nbsp; been named accordingly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-OulsT6kVnlk/VBE-T0ONuxI/AAAAAAAAvy4/kGi3SDR1RwI/s1600/delhggi6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-OulsT6kVnlk/VBE-T0ONuxI/AAAAAAAAvy4/kGi3SDR1RwI/s1600/delhggi6.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nearby 7 metres\nhigh Iron Pillar 912 BC&nbsp; is a\nmetallurgical curiosity, standing in the Qutab complex. The pillar has Brahmic\ninscriptions on it that predate the Islamic minar. &nbsp;It has not rusted due to a phosphorous oxide\npatina or micro film veneer.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yCDHAiU6DNY/VBE-6nqUeyI/AAAAAAAAvzA/-S86KjE6AYQ/s1600/new-delhi-qutub-minar-strucyyuture-detail_640_480.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yCDHAiU6DNY/VBE-6nqUeyI/AAAAAAAAvzA/-S86KjE6AYQ/s1600/new-delhi-qutub-minar-strucyyuture-detail_640_480.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You cant date this pillar by scrapping off the oxide\nveneer. The height of the pillar, from the top of its capital to the bottom of\nits base, is 7.21 m, 1.12 m of which is below ground. Its bell pattern capital\nis 1.07 m in height, and its bulb-shaped base is 0.71 m high.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-W8cjR1SC6uw/VBE_WT_dKvI/AAAAAAAAvzI/rdxCi6BWVhY/s1600/qm3ee3.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"514\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-W8cjR1SC6uw/VBE_WT_dKvI/AAAAAAAAvzI/rdxCi6BWVhY/s1600/qm3ee3.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Garuda on top\nis missing.&nbsp; The base rests on a grid of\niron bars soldered with lead into the upper layer of the dressed stone\npavement. It is estimated to weigh about 6.6 tonnes .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KcfQFBprWuE/VBE_u2bbRMI/AAAAAAAAvzM/hwPFkMZTsa4/s1600/-D0-9A-D1-83-D1-82-D1-83-D0-B1--D0-9C-D0-B8-D0-BDyy6-D0-B0-D1-80-3-300x198.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"263\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KcfQFBprWuE/VBE_u2bbRMI/AAAAAAAAvzM/hwPFkMZTsa4/s1600/-D0-9A-D1-83-D1-82-D1-83-D0-B1--D0-9C-D0-B8-D0-BDyy6-D0-B0-D1-80-3-300x198.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A gigantic red-stone,\nornate gate- way led to the sacred enclave known as Nakshatralaya. &nbsp;There- fore gateway is traditionally known as\nAlaya-Dwar. It has been ridiculously re-named a Allauddin darwaza.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zXlM0BCsupw/VBFAXVF97wI/AAAAAAAAvzU/Kihlp5P4XtI/s1600/QutbMaprr_03.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zXlM0BCsupw/VBFAXVF97wI/AAAAAAAAvzU/Kihlp5P4XtI/s1600/QutbMaprr_03.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\">No Islamic structure has entrances facing north.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WxP2s9pdEng/VBGxoJVsQrI/AAAAAAAAv0E/-X2P5Fg01eg/s1600/Siva-Shakti%2BMeerrrgingghh%2B-medium.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\">BY WAY ,IF THE JUDE STAR HAD EIGHT POINTS -- THE JEWS WOULD HAVE HOLLERED 8 MILLION DIED IN WORLD WAR 2 .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3gmWg7HJ3-4/VBGxvuYWa6I/AAAAAAAAv0M/pE39z-OYfaI/s1600/imageddeF3s%2B(70).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: red;\">sorry, we Hindus will NOT change our symbols-- below ANAHATA CHAKRA&nbsp;</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6hVZKY_vqso/VBGx7asA7bI/AAAAAAAAv0U/PfAYfPruYA0/s1600/imagr3es.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"394\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6hVZKY_vqso/VBGx7asA7bI/AAAAAAAAv0U/PfAYfPruYA0/s1600/imagr3es.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Western astrology takes\nthe tropical approach, whereas Hindu astrology takes the ACCURATE sidereal one.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;This\nresults in the originally unified zodiacal coordinate system drifting apart\ngradually, with a clockwise (westward) precession of 1.4 degrees per century.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For the tropical zodiac\nused in Western astronomy and astrology, this means that the tropical sign of\nAries currently lies somewhere within the constellation Pisces (\"Age of\nPisces\").&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Most perceptive modern Western astrologers,\nhave advocated abandoning the tropical system in favour of a sidereal one. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is what happens\nwhen you steal without understanding the concepts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedic Hindu astronomy\nuses sidereal time which takes into account the precession of the\nequinoxes\u2014though the white man tries to ridicule us for NOT knowing this\u2014 and\nthat too after immorally after copying from us.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The earth revolves\naround the sun in a ELLIPTICAL orbit -- and at the same time the earth wobbles\non its own axis -- like a slowed down top, where it takes 25765 years for a\nfull round wobble ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Malayalam\nMonth ( sidereal )&nbsp;&nbsp; / English\nMonths&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chingam /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 16 August -15 September<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kanni&nbsp; /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n16 September -15 October<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thulam&nbsp;&nbsp; /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n16 October -15 November<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vrischikam/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 16 November -15 December<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dhanu /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 16 December -14 January<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Makaram/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 15 January \u201314 February<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kumbham/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 15 February -14 March<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meenam/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 15 March -14 April<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Medam/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 15 April -15 May<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Edavam/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 16 May -15 June<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Midhunam/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 16 June -15 July<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karkhidakam/&nbsp; 16 July -15 August<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the day, the Sun\nleaves Meenam Rasi and enters Meda Rasi, it is Vishu Sankraman and Malayalam\nfestival Vishu is celebrated the next day.&nbsp;\nThe first day for Medam is the unchangeable day of Vishu, whereas other\nfestivals are determined according to the lunar asterisms on which they fall. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tropical\nZodiac/&nbsp; English Months<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aries/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 21 March \u201320 April&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Taurus/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 21 April \u201321 May&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gemini /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 22 May \u2013 21 June&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cancer/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 22 June \u201322 July<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Leo /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 23 July \u2013 22 August&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Virgo&nbsp; /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n23 August \u201323 September&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Libra /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 24 September \u2013 23 October&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scorpio/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 24 October \u201322 November&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sagittarius/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 23 November \u201321 December <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capricorn/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 22 December \u201320 January&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aquarius /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 21 January \u201319 February&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pisces&nbsp; / &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20 February \u201320 March<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mind you ,all these\nfancy English ( Greeko ) names are all STOLEN from the ancient Hindu\ncalendar.&nbsp; All their constellations names\ntoo are stolen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just a few examples:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tulam is Libra (\nbalance ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chingam or Simham is\nLeo ( lion )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kanni or kanya is Virgo\n( virgin girl )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meenam is Pisces ( fish\n)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kumbam is Aquarius (\nwater pot ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Midhunam is Gemini (\ncouple )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The precession of the\nequinoxes of the Earth is a motion that causes the axis of the Earth's rotation\nto remain FIXED at an angle of 23.4 degrees, however, it rotates along a great\ncircle with a period of 25765 years. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The result is that the\ntwo points where the equator of the Earth intersect the ecliptic plane, the\nvernal and autumnal equinoxes, precess westward along the ecliptic by 360\ndegrees per 25,765 years or 50.26 seconds of arc per year. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-SxiwGDkU15g/VBJdqa73kHI/AAAAAAAAv4E/nMvtFfbeKpM/s1600/imfvages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-SxiwGDkU15g/VBJdqa73kHI/AAAAAAAAv4E/nMvtFfbeKpM/s1600/imfvages.jpg\" width=\"298\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is also equal to\n0.125 seconds of arc per day or 0.008 seconds of time, so that each day the\nsynchronization between sidereal and solar time slips a bit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE VERNAL EQUINOX AS A\nRESULT OF PRECESSION MOVES 50.26 ARC SECONDS WESTWARDS EVERY YEAR RELATIVE TO\nTHE STARS.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1pYFpx1kEEI/VBJeJrxlOMI/AAAAAAAAv4M/OA3lvbtkz0M/s1600/issdfmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"398\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1pYFpx1kEEI/VBJeJrxlOMI/AAAAAAAAv4M/OA3lvbtkz0M/s1600/issdfmages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE EARTH TAKES 20\nMINUTES TO REVOLVE THOUGH AN ARC OF 50.26 SECONDS IN ITS ORBIT, SO THE TROPICAL\nYEAR ( YEAR OF SEASONS ) IS 20 MINUTES SHORTER THAN THE SIDERIAL YEAR.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-AbkZPsixrIA/VBJbP6GXPjI/AAAAAAAAv34/iam-Gm4KUCU/s1600/Vishnu_seshnago7o_thailand.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-AbkZPsixrIA/VBJbP6GXPjI/AAAAAAAAv34/iam-Gm4KUCU/s1600/Vishnu_seshnago7o_thailand.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">A cycle of four yugas\ntakes 25765 years ( instead of 4,230,000 ).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Precession of the earth\nis approx. 50.26 seconds every year.. .( 1 degree is 60 minutes and 1minute is\n60 seconds )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-o1eNm_qEfQ4/VBJJc3eaWHI/AAAAAAAAv18/aH5hgcHMvXQ/s1600/imagees.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"238\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-o1eNm_qEfQ4/VBJJc3eaWHI/AAAAAAAAv18/aH5hgcHMvXQ/s1600/imagees.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 25765 years is\ndivided into 4 yugas in a ratio of 4:3:2:1. ( satya/ treta/ dwapara/ kali ) .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Maya Danava composed\nthe Surya Siddhantam towards the end of Krta Yuga. &nbsp;He gave his daughter Mandodari in marriage to\nRavana. &nbsp;He built &nbsp;the Maya Sabha for the\nPandavas in IndraPrastha in the Dwapara Yuga. &nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">So he lived for a part of Kruta Yuga, the\nentire Tretha Yuga and a part of Dwapara Yuga.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>MAYA , INCA , AZTEC\nCIVILIZATIONS DECODED &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The sun has this &nbsp;motion by which it revolves round a grand\ncenter called Vishnunabhi, which is the seat of the creative power.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The yugas during the\napproach to Vishnunabhi are 'ascending' yugas; those during the retreat from\nVishnunabhi 'descending' yugas. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Cosmic mechanism is in\nreality is a spiral, never a stagnant circle. A cycle of four yugas takes 25765\nyears instead of 4,230,000.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The first point of Pisces was the place where the equinoxial\ncuts the ecliptic &nbsp;till 21<sup>st</sup> Dec 2012.&nbsp; &nbsp;From\n2012 AD it is aquarius ( indian kumbam )-- a new age, new sunrise at spring\nequinox -- precession of the equinoxes and markes the end of Kali yugam.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WH6ZLZw1698/VBJL56iI7aI/AAAAAAAAv2Q/RPqdATnLk_g/s1600/yuga-cyEEcle.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"344\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WH6ZLZw1698/VBJL56iI7aI/AAAAAAAAv2Q/RPqdATnLk_g/s1600/yuga-cyEEcle.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">Dharma walks on four feet in Krutha/Satya Yuga, on 3 feet in Tretha Yuga, on two feet in Dwapara Yuga and one foot in Kaliyuga- this is an allegory.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">BELOW: BEGGARS WHO DRESS UP AS KINGS WILL BE DECIMATED BY KALKI AVATAR -- BIG BROTHER AND HIS STOOGES TAKE NOTE !</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UzhOTME6oXQ/VBJJ3AgGOwI/AAAAAAAAv2E/4HdO8OiaWDU/s1600/kaddlki.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">At the end of &nbsp;Kali Yuga the Kalki avatar kicks in &nbsp;( 21st Dec 2012 ) --with a cusp of 30 years .</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EygODOac_qA/VBJDz1P4M1I/AAAAAAAAv1s/7jkHSYAKkWc/s1600/imaffees.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EygODOac_qA/VBJDz1P4M1I/AAAAAAAAv1s/7jkHSYAKkWc/s1600/imaffees.jpg\" width=\"312\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yugas during the\napproach to Vishnunabhi are 'ascending' yugas; those during the retreat from\nVishnunabhi 'descending' yugas.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UlUvIKXEwRs/VBJeupfGK6I/AAAAAAAAv4U/AogvMhQg4dQ/s1600/imu5uages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hindu Puranas\ndescribe a number of cycles within cycles, with and cycle measured in different\ntypes of units . &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; It takes 25785.91 years for 1\nfull circle \u2013 \u2018 for Revati to \u2018return\u201d<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_24M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1452794498528#c4230241667479037661\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 14, 2016 at 11:31 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_24MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi ar,<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nall calenders on the planet are derived from the calender of asura MAYA DANAVA in sanskrit/ malayalam.<br />\n<br />\nMaya Danava was the father of mandodari, the beautiful wife of ravana.<br />\n<br />\nduryodhana fell in the pool of the palace made by maya danava at indraprasta. maya danava escaped to peru ( patala ) when Shiva got pissed off with him<br />\n<br />\nMaya Danava's sons Dundhubi and Mayavi were killed by the Vali.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/10/king-vali-and-queen-tara-of-ramayana.html<br />\n<br />\nMaya is the author of Surya Siddhantam.<br />\n<br />\nIn Bhagavad Gita, Krishna tells Arjun, that among Nakshtras he is Abhijit. Hence Abhijit Nakshatra is an auspicious time in the Hindu Calendar<br />\n<br />\nAbhijit is the Sanskrit name for Vega, the brightest star in the northern constellan of Lyra.<br />\n<br />\nAbhijit\u2019s longitude starts from 06\u00b0 40' to 10\u00b0 53' 20 in sidereal Capricorn i.e. from the last quarter of nakshatra Uttara Ash\u0101dh\u0101 to first 1/15 th part of Shravana.<br />\n<br />\nHence, Abhijit nakshatra is not a regular nakshatra with four padas or quarters, it serves as an intercalary asterism most of the times.<br />\n<br />\nEach of the 27 asterisms ( nakshatras) is feminine, only Abhijit is masculine.<br />\n<br />\nHowever , Moon ( Chandra) is said to have 27 (not 28) wives with whom he stays for one day in a sidereal lunar month.<br />\n<br />\nNakshatra is the term for lunar mansion in Hindu astrology. A nakshatra is one of 27 sectors along the ecliptic.<br />\nThe starting point for the nakshatras is the point on the ecliptic directly opposite to the star Spica called Chitr\u0101 in Sanskrit . It is called Mesh\u0101di or the \"first point of Aries\".<br />\n<br />\nIn Hindu sidereal astrology the first point of Aries remains aligned with Ras Hammel \"the head of the ram\", i.e. the Aries constellation.<br />\n<br />\nThe ecliptic is divided into each of the nakshatras eastwards starting from this point. The number of nakshatras reflects the number of days in a sidereal month (modern value: 27.32 days), the width of a nakshatra traversed by the Moon in about one day. Each nakshatra is further subdivided into four quarters (or padas).<br />\n<br />\nThese play a role in popular Hindu astrology, where each pada is associated with a syllable, conventionally chosen as the first syllable of the given name of a child born when the Moon was in the corresponding pada.<br />\n<br />\nHowever in the Atharva Veda 19.7( 5000 BC ) there are 28 nakshatras\u2014which includes Abhijit. The classical concept of a \"lunar mansion\" was first found in the Atharvaveda.<br />\n<br />\nIn the Atharvaveda (Shaunakiya recension, hymn 19.7) a list of 28 stars or asterisms is given, many of them corresponding to the later nakshatras:<br />\n<br />\n(1) K\u1e5bttik\u0101 (the Pleiads), (2) Rohin\u012b, (3) Mrigash\u012brsha, (4) \u0100rdr\u0101, (5) Punarvasu, (6) S\u016bnrit\u0101, (7) Pushya, (8) Bhanu (the Sun), (9) Aslesh\u0101, (10) Magh\u0101, (11) Sv\u0101ti (Arcturus), (12) Chitr\u0101 (Spica), (13) Phalgunis, (14) Hasta, (15) R\u0101dhas, (16) Vish\u0101kh\u0101, (17) Anur\u0101dh\u0101, (18) Jyeshth\u0101, (19) M\u016bla, (20) Ash\u0101dhas, (21) Abhijit, (22) Sravana, (23) Sravishth\u0101s, (24) Satabhishak, (25) Proshtha-padas, (26) Revati, (27) Asvayujas, (28) Bharani.<br />\n<br />\nThe first astronomical text that lists them is the Vedanga Jyotisha.<br />\n<br />\nThe creation of the nakshatras is attributed to Daksha. Maya Danava was a descendant of Danu, one of Kasyapa\u2018s 13 wives and a daughter of Dakhsa Prajapati.<br />\n<br />\nThey are personified as daughters of the deity and as wives of Chandra, the Moon god, or alternatively the daughters of Kashyapa, the brother of Daksha.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/maya-inca-aztec-civilizations-decoded.html<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_24MN\" kind=\"m\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_24BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_24B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_25B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.0980392) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5613966028619610796\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_25M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1452794542095#c5613966028619610796\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 14, 2016 at 11:32 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_25MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nEach of the nakshatras is governed as 'lord' by one of the nine graha in the following sequence: Ketu (South Lunar Node), Shukra (Venus), Ravi or Surya (Sun), Chandra (Moon), Mangala (Mars), Rahu (North Lunar Node), Guru or Brihaspati (Jupiter), Shani (Saturn) and Budha (Mercury).<br />\n<br />\nThis cycle repeats itself three times to cover all 27 nakshatras. The lord of each nakshatra determines the planetary period known as the dasha, which is considered of major importance in forecasting the life path of the individual in Hindu astrology.<br />\n<br />\nIn Surya Siddhanta Maya Danava equated TIME with \"nakshatra\". Maya Danava wrote that a \"prana\" is a duration of 4 seconds. He then continues with a discussion of a number of time units with progressively long durations made up of the shorter time units all composed of a number of pranas. Amongst those time units are something he calls \"nakshatra.\"<br />\n<br />\nFor example, there are 15 pranas in a minute; 900 pranas in an hour; 21600 pranas in a day, 583,200 pranas in a nakshatra (month). Thus a nakshatra is a time unit with a duration of 27 days. This 27 day time cycle has been taken to mean a particular group of stars.<br />\n<br />\nThe relationship to the stars really has to do with the periodicity with which the Moon travels over time and through space past the field of the specific stars called nakshatras.<br />\n<br />\nHence, the stars are more like numbers on a clock through which the hands of time pass (the moon). Over time , this concept that nakshatra means a time unit has been lost and diverted to meaning a set of stars in the sky.<br />\n<br />\nThe Moon remains in each Nakshatra for approximately one day.<br />\n<br />\nThe nakshartas are now used as celestial markers in the heavens. When these were mapped into equal divisions of the ecliptic, a division of 27 portions was adopted since that resulted in a cleaner definition of each portion (i.e. segment) subtending 13\u00b0 20' (as opposed to 12\u00b0 51 3/7\u2019 in the case of 28 segments).<br />\n<br />\nIn the process, the Nakshatra Abhijit was left out without a portion. The Surya Siddhantha of Maya Danava concisely specifies the coordinates of the twenty seven Nakshatras<br />\n<br />\nHindu astrologers teach that when a child is born, they should be given an auspicious first name which will correspond to the child's Nakshatra. The technique for deducing the name is to see which nakshatra the Moon is in at the moment of birth; this gives four possible sounds.<br />\n<br />\nA refinement is to pick one sound out of that four that relates to the Pada or division of the Nakshatra. Each Nakshatra has four Padas and four sounds and each Pada is of equal width. The upper word is the nakshatra, the constellation of stars (asterisms) nearest to the moon on that day.<br />\n<br />\nMALAYALAM/ SANSKRIT<br />\nAswati/ Aswini<br />\nBharani/ Bharani<br />\nKartika/ Krttika<br />\nRohini/ Rohini<br />\nMakayiram/ MrgaShirsha<br />\nThiruAthira/ Ardra<br />\nPunartham /Punarvasu<br />\nPooyam/ Pushya<br />\nAyilyam/ Aashlesha<br />\nMakam/ Magha<br />\nPooram/ Poorva Phalguni<br />\nUthram/ Uthara Phalguni<br />\nAtham/ Hastam<br />\nChithira/ Chitra<br />\nChothi/ Swathi<br />\nVisakham/ Visakha<br />\nAnizham/ Anuradha<br />\nKetta/ Jyeshta<br />\nMoolam/ Moola<br />\nPooradam/ PoorvaAshadha<br />\nUthradam/ UtharaAshada<br />\n(Abhijit)/ (Abhijit)<br />\nThiruOnam/ Shravana<br />\nAvittam/ Shravishta<br />\nChathayam/ Shathabhisha<br />\nPooruruttathi/ PoorvaBhadrapada<br />\nUthrttahi /UtharaBhadrapada<br />\nRevathi/ Revathi<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_25MN\" kind=\"m\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_25BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_25B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_26B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; border-bottom-width: 0px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.0980392) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2501415959257901599\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_26M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1452794572561#c2501415959257901599\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 14, 2016 at 11:32 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_26MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nThe period of revolution of the moon is not an exact integer multiple of the period of rotation of the Earth: it is 27.3 days. Hence a 28th nakshatra (Abhijit) with an unusually short interval (about eight hours) is inserted to compensate for this.<br />\n<br />\nInitially, the zodiac was grouped in 12 Rashis for convenience, however the ancient seers have farther subdivided the heavens into 27 Nakshatras or star constellations for the call of precession. These constellations or the Nakshatras emerged as one of the most important components in Astrology.<br />\n<br />\nVedic astrology identifies each constellation with a star. The 360 degree division of the sky is therefore further divided into 27 subdivision of 13.20 degrees identified with 27 stars. Each of these Nakshatras are farther subdivided into four Padas or quarters of 3 degrees and 20 minutes.<br />\n<br />\nTherefore the first Rashi, Mesha, which has 30 degrees, contains the entire 4 Padas (13:20\u2032) of the 1st star constellation Ashwini, the entire 4 Padas (13:20\u2032) of the 2nd star constellation Bharani and the 1st Pada (3:20\u2032) of the third star constellation Krittika. In this manner, each Rashi comprises of 9 Padas<br />\n<br />\nThese Nakshatras are broadly classified under the three heads of Deva (divine), Nara (human) and Rakshasa (Demonic).<br />\nNo/ Nakshatras /Astronomical Name/ Deity/Ruling Planet Starting Dasha/ Colour<br />\n28 /Abhijit / Vega / Brahma / Sun / Brownish yellow<br />\n<br />\nAbhijit Muhurat is AN auspicious time during midday of about 48 minutes. Abhijit Muhurat is capable of destroying innumerable Doshas and it is considered one of the best Muhurats to start all sort of auspicious works.<br />\n<br />\nLord Shiva killed demon Tripurasur during Abhijit Muhurat. Abhijit Muhurat is also not suitable for Manglik activities like marriage and Upanayana ceremonies. The duration of the abhijit muhurat lingers up to 48 minutes. 24 minutes before and after the sidereal time is called the abhijit muhurat.<br />\n<br />\nAs the abhijit muhurat is auspicious people opt for this muhurat to perform their work. Abhijit muhurat safeguards a work even if the day is inauspicious. Astrologers say that if in any condition an auspicious work does not have a good muhurat then you can perform their work on the auspicious abhijit muhurat.<br />\n<br />\nHence the 28th intercalary nakshatra to compensate for the sidereal month being<br />\neight hours more than 27 days is Abhijit (alpha, epsilon and zeta<br />\nLyrae - Vega ) - between Uttarashada and Sravana.<br />\n<br />\nEvery Zodiac sign is copied from Malayalam / Sanskrit\u2014THIEVES !<br />\nChingam/ Leo<br />\nKanni/ Virgo<br />\nThulam/ Libra<br />\nVrshchikam/ Scorpio<br />\nDhanu/ Bow(Sagittarius)<br />\nMakaram /Sea-monster(Capricorn or Goat)<br />\nKumbham/ Water Pot(Aquarius)<br />\nMeenam/ Fish(Pisces)<br />\nMedam/ Ram<br />\nIdavam/ Bull(Taurus)<br />\nMidhunum / Couple(Gemini)<br />\nKarkkadakam/ Crab(Cancer)<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: orange; The whole cosmos is interconnected in this field and speed is NOT restricted to Einstein's SPEED OF LIGHT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Sri Yantra ( DIVINE GEOMETRY OF OM ) which follows the Fibonacci series and the Golden ratio ( lifted from 7000 year old Vedic Mathematics ) is the mystical 3D holographic construct of the Cosmos by 9 VIRTUAL SPIRALLING VORTEX CONES \u2014 4 pointing upwards and 5 pointing downwards, as a sort of ying-yang balance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The master cellular control system of the human body is holographic. Nothing we experience escapes being imprinted into our Cellular Hologram in the form of a cell memory. What we commonly refer to as \"The Cellular Memory\" is the collective energy field generated by these individual cell memories.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Sanatana Dharma was the first to understand the holographic nature of the cosmos. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965\u0969\u096b\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nI will not keep any other God in my heart, except Hanuman.<br />\nSo I will not even remember Ram/Vishnu (even though Hanuman himself worships\nRam)?<br />\n<br />\nThis never felt right.<br />\n<br />\nAs soon as Ajit ji wrote this, it was a Eureka moment.<br />\n<br />\nMany thanks, Ajit ji.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; ALL THESE SPIRES WERE STOLEN BY THE WHITE INVADER LEAVING BEHIND COPPER ONES<br />\n<br />\nParashurama \"consecrated\" 108 idols in kerala-- incuding one at Sabarimala for a future Vishnu avatar ( Ayyappa )<br />\n<br />\nTHREE POINTS ARE VERY IMPORTANT -- THE POSITION AND HEIGHT OF THE THIRD EYE OF THE BLACK IDOL, THE POSITION AND HEIGHT OF THE STAMBHA ( METAL CASED POLE ) AND THE POSITION OF THE PRASADAM HOLY WATER TABERNACLE.<br />\n<br />\nOn top of the sthamba is the vahana of the diety .<br />\n<br />\nDHWAJA means TWO ( triangles ) in sanskrit and malayalam .<br />\n<br />\nThe flag staff is installed in FRONT of the deity's eyebrows -- and from far away a devotee knows what is what.<br />\n<br />\nA line making an angle of 23.4 degrees with the normal sight line of the idol should cut exactly the top of the Dhwaja. This 23.4 degree and 108 is linked to Vishnu's vamana avatar ( boar ).<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/05/vishnu-avatar-varaha-boar-fixing-planet.html</span><br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_108BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; A hole is made in the roof of the Mandapa where the line of the above angle touches the roof.<br />\n<br />\nThe middle point between the eyebrows of the idol, the hole in the roof and the top of the Dhwaja is in the same line.<br />\n<br />\nThe above angle line when extended should reach the top of the Kalasa the Gali-Gopuram. The Gali-Gopuram should be constructed at thr right distance.<br />\n<br />\nAs the earth axis is tilted to an angle of 23.4 degrees the small hole, the top of the Dhwaja and the top of the Gali-Gopuram should be in a line making an angle of 23.4 degrees with the normal sight line of the idol for the optimum powerful radiation of the directional power.<br />\n<br />\nA TEMPLE STUMBHA IS A QUARTER LAMBDA ANTENNA --NOT FOR ELECTROMAGNETIC WAVES BUT FOR SCALAR WAVES --HOWEVER IT FULLFILLS CONDITIONS FOR ELECTROMAGNETIC SPECTRUM.<br />\n<br />\nEVERY STAMBHA IN ANCIENT TIMES HAS IRRIDIUM AND RHODIUM INHERENT IN THE VAHANA FIGURE OF THE DEITY RIGHT ON TOP. VAHANA MEANS CARRIER ( WAVE ).<br />\n<br />\nToday any incoming missile is shot down in seconds using circular arrays are composed of thousands of crossed dipole antennas.<br />\n<br />\nThe impedance of a 1/4 lambda Marconi antenna is 36.6 ohms.A \u00bd lambda dipole has an impedance of about 70 ohms . Remember scalar energy cannot be measured today--probably they will do it 500 years from today.<br />\n<br />\nTHE FLAG MAST OF A TEMPLE IS PRECISION GEOMETRY.<br />\n<br />\nARANMULA AIRPORT AUTHORITIES ( CHRISTIAN ) WANTED THE FLAG POLE TO BE CROPPED AND REMOVE ARANMULA MIRROR PRODUCTION<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/11/aranmula-airport-kerala-mindless-rape.html</span><br />\n<br />\nDESPITE TELLING PM MODI AT LEAST 60 TIMES-- EVEN LAST YEAR THE TAMIL DALITS / CHRISTIAN NGOs SANG \" DEVI ( SHIVAs WIFE ) NEEDS A PRICK AS LARGE AS THE KODIMARAM TO BE SEXUALLY SATISFIED\"<br />\n<br />\nTHEY DONT KNOW THAT SHIVA AND HIS WIFE ARE COSMIC ALLEGORIES .. PEOPLE JUST DONT ACCEPT IT..<br />\n<br />\nBUT IT IS VERY EASY TO PROVE THAT YOUR ARE FASTER THAN SOME ONE IN A SPRINT OR STRONGER IN A GYM...<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">MAN IS STILL AN ANIMAL --ALBEIT A SOCIAL ONE</span><br />\n<br />\nWHEN YOU PROVE YOU ARE STRONGER THAN SOMEONE --HE HAS NO PROBLEMS IN ACCEPTING YOU ARE BETTER THAN HIM IN THE BRAINS DEPT..<br />\n<br />\nEXAMPLE:<br />\n<br />\nA BRIT USED TO COME IN OUR GYM.. A VERY STRONG FELLOW-- TALLER THAN ME, HIS BICEPS WERE TWICE THE SIZE OF MINE , HE WAS ONE YEAR YOUNGER.<br />\n<br />\nONCE OR TWICE I HAD A CONVERSATION WITH HIM, HE GAVE ME THE FEELING THAT HE THINKS HE IS BETTER THAN ME IN THE BRAINS DEPT..<br />\n<br />\nI DO EXPERIMENTS ..<br />\n<br />\nI NOTICE THAT HE DID CURLS ON THE 25 KG DUMB BELLS - AND BEFORE DOING THAT HE TOOK OUT TWO HANDKERCHIEFS TO WRAP IT AROUND THE \" UNUSED HENCE SHARP \" KNURLED STEEL HANDLE..<br />\n<br />\nHE DID NOT HAVE HIS OWN GYM GLOVES WHICH COVERED THE FINGERS TOO ( BRUISING DIE TO SKIN GETTING SCRAPED OFF ) ..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/06/dumb-bells-challenge-real-thing-capt.html</span><br />\n<br />\nIT JUST PROVED HE WAS SERIOUS-- HE WOULD KEEP THE DUMB BELLS DOWN ONLY IF HIS BICEPS OR BACK HURT--NOT BECAUSE HIS PALM SKIN WAS HURTING ( THE WAY OTHER PRETENDED ).<br />\n<br />\nWHEN I DID THE 25 KG DUMB BELLS CURLS , I BROUGHT MY OWN HANDKERCHIEFS TO WRAP AROUND THE HANDLE.<br />\n<br />\nSO ONE DAY WHEN HE FINISHED ON THE 25 KG DUMBELLS --I ASKED HIM \"CAN I TAKE IT \" AND STARTED WRAPPING MY CLOTH PIECES .. HE WAS NOW WATCHING ME VIA THE MIRROR.<br />\n<br />\nI DID TWICE OF WHAT HE DID ON HALF THE TIME..<br />\n<br />\nWHEN I LOOKED AT HIS FACE , IT WAS RED-- HE WAS EMBARRASSED ..<br />\n<br />\nTHEN MY YOUNGER SON DID THE MACHINES HE USUALLY DOES-- PUTTING ALL PINS AT HIGHEST NOTCH.. MY SON IS 1/3 OF HIS AGE AND HE WEIGHS 20 KGS MORE THAN HIM..<br />\n<br />\nHE AVOIDED THOSE MACHINES LIKE THE PLAGUE.. I HAD CRAMPED HIS COCKY STYLE<br />\n<br />\nI KNEW HE WAS FROM THE VILLAGE WHERE STONEHENGE IS BUILT. HE HAD TOLD ME THAT ALIENS BUILT THE STONEHENGE AS IT IS SUPERHUMAN..<br />\n<br />\nNOW THAT I HAD CRAMPED HIS STYLE-- I ASKED HIM, IF HE DID ICE SLEDGING AS A CHILD..<br />\n<br />\nHE SAID-- YES..<br />\n<br />\nTHEN I TOLD HIM-- IF YOU GIVE ME THREE STRONG MEN , I DONT NEED ALIENS -I WILL BUILD THE SAME STRUCTURE.<br />\n<br />\nI TOLD HIM--<br />\n<br />\nI KNOW THE STONE QUARRY FROM WHERE THE STONES WERE SOURCED.. IN WINTER I WOULD SLIDE IT DOWNHILL ON THE ICE AND FIT IT IN PLACE ..USING LONG LEVERS..<br />\n<br />\nHE KEPT QUIET<br />\n<br />\nTHEN I ASKED HIM-- DO YOU KNOW HOW MANY PORTALS ARE THERE..<br />\n<br />\nHE DID NOT KNOW.<br />\n<br />\nI TOLD HIM-- 27 NAKSHATRAS ( PORTALS ) WITH 4 PADAS MADE THE NUMBER 108, AND THIS IS THE DIGITAL NUMBER OF OM, OUR HINDU KING MANTRA..<br />\n<br />\nTHE DRUID SAGES WHO BUILT THE STONEHENGE WERE HINDUS..<br />\n<br />\nHE WAS QUIET FOR SOME TIME AND THEN HE SAID \" TODAY I HAVE LEARNT SOMETHING \"<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/01/mystery-of-stonehenge-solved-capt-ajit.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html</span><br />\n<br />\nI WAS A CHANGE MANAGER AT SEA.. YOU CANNOT CHANGE ALL BY THE SAME WAY..BY SHOVING THINGS DOWN THE THROAT. YOU HAVE TO MAKE THEM BITE.<br />\n<br />\nALL MY DETRACTORS HAVE FALLEN BY THE WAY SIDE TODAY.. PEOPLE DONT ARGUE ANYMORE--WHEN I SAY THIS IS THE WAY THE COOKIE CRUMBLED..<br />\n<br />\nTODAY NO MUSLIM ARGUES WHEN I SAY THAT QUTAB MINAR IS A HINDU STRUCTURE<br />\n<br />\nQUTAB MINAR IS MEANT TO BE SEEN FROM TOP FROM A HOVERING HELICOPTER..<br />\n<br />\nTHE TOP BRAHMA PLATFORM WAS UNSTABLE-- MEANT TO SHOW THE PRECESSION OF THE EARTH..
